commit_message:
Remove legacy models.py files

There are a number of models.py files lying around. This is legacy (see
https://code.djangoproject.com/ticket/7198). This patch removes those
files.

Closes-Bug: 1516589

subject: tox: add /bin/bash to whitelist_externals
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-09 09:40:14.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'tox: add /bin/bash to whitelist_externals

Since tox 1.5, commands outside the virtual environment must be
explicitly listed in whitelist_externals. Without that, some commands
emit the warning:

    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
       cmd: /bin/bash
       env: ...
    See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Change-Id: Iad1f623defbb32dafb5bad3613cec7a8409e2b2c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
tox: add /bin/bash to whitelist_externals

Since tox 1.5, commands outside the virtual environment must be
explicitly listed in whitelist_externals. Without that, some commands
emit the warning:

    WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
       cmd: /bin/bash
       env: ...
    See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

Change-Id: Iad1f623defbb32dafb5bad3613cec7a8409e2b2c

commit_message:
Update building for liberty

Disable all non-translated and non-versioned guides for translation.
Only build backported guides (install-guide and config-reference).
Do not publish web pages.

Change-Id: I2141b69244c7b60bfbec275fea3c1fda4e1e857b

commit_message:
[V3] Make region_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes region_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Icde61f9b50bbf3269ede0074d70396355e83b755

[V3] Make policy_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes policy_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
[V3] Make credentials_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes credentials_client use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Icf953bf7234376a877831f88313d935aec25f9bb

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-11-15 08:20:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove the useless l3plugin check in l3_rpc.py

According to neutron.manager.NeutronManager, it is impossible to
have "L3_ROUTER_NAT: None" in neutron's service_plugins. And,
without "L3_ROUTER_NAT" in neutron's service_plugins, l3_rpc will
fail when getting l3plugin. So, remove the useless "if" block
here.

Change-Id: I56f417e5723ed40c70a186394de0bfcff696e469
Closes-Bug: #1514144

Closes-Bug: #1514144
', 'number': 8}]
commit_message:
Remove the useless l3plugin check in l3_rpc.py

Without "L3_ROUTER_NAT" in neutron's service_plugins, l3_rpc will
fail when getting l3plugin. So, remove the useless "if" block
here.

Change-Id: I56f417e5723ed40c70a186394de0bfcff696e469
Closes-Bug: #1514144

commit_message:
Reactivating admin public image returns 500

The actual call is reactivate not activate. Therefore to stop the
internal server error occuring the activate needs to be renamed.

Change-Id: I9c74a3cd2bd460c6947477052af07838ef278d59
Closes-bug: 1515305

commit_message:
Python3: fix glance.tests.unit.test_migrations

In Python3, map() is only called if it is consumed. The calls removed
in this patch were no-ops.

Change-Id: I83e2ee05bcda4b765d67dfb6558c6e59afe6f816

commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: I741b7cae51555bc5f8d79a018598d1dccbba4459

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-16 13:47:39.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Block keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 and keystoneclient 1.8.0

The keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 release and keystoneclient 1.8.0 release
contain invalid requirements, capping WebOb that was supposed to be
temporary. This caused keystone-all to fail to start due to
conflicting requirements with other packages.

Change-Id: I7e1e3885d7ea64640a1fa12c51bab1d51ab0dcb3
Related-Bug: 1505996
(cherry picked from commit 3d36502b15abf8146e985dc21a185f0c159d2430)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Block keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 and keystoneclient 1.8.0

The keystonemiddleware 2.4.0 release and keystoneclient 1.8.0 release
contain invalid requirements, capping WebOb that was supposed to be
temporary. This caused keystone-all to fail to start due to
conflicting requirements with other packages.

Change-Id: I7e1e3885d7ea64640a1fa12c51bab1d51ab0dcb3
Related-Bug: 1505996
(cherry picked from commit 3d36502b15abf8146e985dc21a185f0c159d2430)

commit_message:
Feature/Bug workflow corrections

Removing broken reference in index.rst that raised a warning.

Changing the Security bug process to file security bug first rather
than having to track down Searchlight security or VMT first.

Change-Id: Iea69c94ce2ed05688e0b93e6f00c4991f4cf1341

subject: Enable "openstack server unlock" command to take multiple servers.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-12 03:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/commands.rst', 'doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Enable "openstack server unlock" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server unlock" command could only unlock one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve the

Change-Id: Ibf57b2021a504da950a491d63139a438087aed0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable "openstack server unlock" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server unlock" command could only unlock one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve the
doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: Ibf57b2021a504da950a491d63139a438087aed0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Filter out disk.config for existing instances without config drive

Even force_config_drive is changed to True or always, existing
instances which are not configured with config drive should still
keep the old behavior.

Change-Id: I074a5823645a3e18cc8cd6824c1058adff36a34d
Closes-Bug: #1356534
Co-authored-by: wuhao <wuhao@unitedstack.com>

subject: Switch ansible-functional job zuul-git-prep
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-17 01:50:15.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/ansible-role-jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Switch ansible-functional job zuul-git-prep

Since we only have a single module right now, we don't need to full
ability to zuul-clone.  We are also running into a 127 char shebang
limit with execve so this will reduce our directory name.

Change-Id: I024f414ddae85621a861b21d284ea1e417c4438d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Switch ansible-functional job zuul-git-prep

Since we only have a single module right now, we don't need to full
ability to zuul-clone.  We are also running into a 127 char shebang
limit with execve so this will reduce our directory name.

Change-Id: I024f414ddae85621a861b21d284ea1e417c4438d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: remove unnecessary else in blockinfo.get_root_info

The "if no_root_bdm" conditional returns on it's own so there is no
reason to have the else check.

This is just trivial code cleanup.

Change-Id: I82e310b769d6a218cd94c785830f453795075b53

commit_message:
Increase minimal Jinja2 version from 2.6 to 2.8

Jinja version 2.6 does not support Python v3.

Jinja version 2.8 is latest stable release
ant it supports Python v3 (actually from version 2.7)

http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/dev/intro/#experimental-python-3-support

Change-Id: I4c2e3746429def850053dcc7d204dd488c033cbc

commit_message:
Bump oslo.service to latest version

The latest oslo.service release exposes a new configuration
option, as such we should bump to this version, otherwise
folks configuring this option with an old version of
oslo.service may get incorrect results.

Change-Id: I3dd0692743fcecff056674580fe57901963b4ccd

commit_message:
Bumps os-win version to 0.0.6

Adds utilsfactory function get_smbutils.
Adds iscsi_target_utils methods (iscsi_target_exists, extend_wt_disk).
Adds IO related utils for serial console handlers.
Adds share capacity info bugfix.
Adds Secure Boot related utils.

commit_message:
Use admin context when requesting floating ip's router info

Currently it is possible for admin to create router and add any
tenant subnet to it, thus connecting the subnet to the external
network. In this case tenant user can assign floating ips to its
VMs though it does not own the router.
For proper notification we need to get router info using admin
context.

Closes-Bug: #1507602
Change-Id: I17330ddca577d15e42c13ef0af96d56e6f20abd7

commit_message:
Improve validation of input node labels data via jsonschema

Now node labels are validated according to following rules:
* node labels data is dictionary where keys are names of labels and
  values are also values of labels;
* Label name must be string less than 100 symbols also non-empty;
* Label value must be either None (null in json format) or string also
  less that 100 symbols and non-empty

Change-Id: Iac3e9a33591a52ba48510be26316d665322961a2
Closes-Bug: #1482639

commit_message:
Allow a user to override the toxworkdir (tox.ini)

We are starting to run into tox issue with job names longer then 127
chars [1].  Because our jenkins nodes are destroyed after each run, we
can allow a job to override the toxworkdir setting in tox.ini (for example
/tmp).

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/79/245979/1/check/gate-ansible-dsvm-functional-centos7-nv/f24bec8/console.html#_2015-11-16_23_27_03_935

Change-Id: I6858a2ffec0585d6e747086103e66e891b20f84d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
cleanup tox.ini

* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* sitepackages : default is already false


Change-Id: Id13307a8f7c21496e1d5aad20cd9e2146b8f2fbd

commit_message:
Adds Cinder Volume Support to Swarm Bay Type

Previously, the swarm bay type did not support using a cinder
volume for docker.

Implements: blueprint swarm-cinder

Change-Id: I8acaf60caab52a5e5a234e4c5f89ce3dd155759c

commit_message:
fix html context event handler

The event handler should return a replacement template *name* or None.
Since we don't want to change the template, return None.

Change-Id: I3012ad22505230c488aa4babbd4141d903b7ab0d
Closes-Bug: 1516834

commit_message:
Add total_vms field in API

* bump the api version to 2.13
* add the total_vms to api
* change the current running_vms to the count of the active instances

Closes-Bug: #1325304
Change-Id: I385804e4c220e6c35ee47105106ea6c60e5df9ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-29 07:10:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "rollback status when cold migrate failed.

When you can't access target host during cold migrating,
VM status doesn't rollback.

Cold migration uses ssh command.
There's a precondition which a target host can be connected
using ssh Host key from a source host without prompt.

So, when you are using util.execute(), especially ssh can use
following options.
options :  NumberOfPasswordPrompts=0
           StrictHostKeyChecking=no
           -p 22

And if you want, you can change ssh options using nova.conf

[libvirt]
ssh_connection_options=-o NumberOfPasswordPrompts=0,
-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no, -p 22

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1323989

Change-Id: I4e4155cce5f4d4bcbd02dd2d865017cda79626ab

commit_message:
libvirt: Rollback status when cold migrate failed

When you can't access target host during cold migrating,
VM status doesn't rollback.

Cold migration uses ssh command.
There's a precondition which a target host can be connected
using ssh Host key from a source host without prompt.

So, when you are using util.execute(), especially ssh can use
following options.
options : -T
          -o BatchMode=yes
          -e none

And if you want to change ssh port as 2022 for security reason,
you can change ssh options using nova.conf

[libvirt]
ssh_connection_options=-T, -o BatchMode=yes, -e none, -p 2022

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1323989

Change-Id: I4e4155cce5f4d4bcbd02dd2d865017cda79626ab

commit_message:
Correct disk filter in dealing with volume-based instance

Disk filter should not count root disk size when the instance is
booted from volume.

This patch checks the block device mapping to judge whether the
instance is booted from volume. And if the instance if booted from
volume, the root device size will not be counted.

Change-Id: I511a95a4025788216adfea8e9837289acba97329
Closes-Bug: #1358566

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-12 00:53:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add support for one time tokens in consoleauth

Currently knowing the value of the 'token' is all the authentication that is
required for consoleauth connectsions.  Should this token be discovered by an
unauthorised user it's possible for that person to gain access to the console
of a VM.  The outcome of this depends on what state the console is in.

This patch reduces potential impact of this token being discovered.

When the new config option (console_one_time_token) is enabled all consoleauth
tokens are single use.

This config option should be used in conjunction with console_tokeen_ttl to
minimise the possibilty that a toekn will be mis used.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1447679
Change-Id: I2f71611d26bd2547edc354ab8235303115157e30

Change-Id: I2f71611d26bd2547edc354ab8235303115157e30
", 'number': 6}]
commit_message:
Add support for one time tokens in consoleauth

Currently knowing the value of the 'token' is all the authentication that is
required for consoleauth connections.  Should this token be discovered by an
unauthorised user it's possible for that person to gain access to the console
of a VM.  The outcome of this depends on what state the console is in.

This patch reduces potential impact of this token being discovered.

When the new config option (console_one_time_token) is enabled all
consoleauth tokens are single use.

This config option should be used in conjunction with console_token_ttl to
minimise the possibility that a token will be mis used.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: 1447679
Change-Id: I2f71611d26bd2547edc354ab8235303115157e30

commit_message:
Adding notification points for job completion

Adding notifications for job completion, both consumed and abandoned, so that a
listener can take some action based on job completion.

Change-Id: I826285d4bfccd2406df7b59e53a9b724702ed094

commit_message:
Serialize user auth plugin

This is an important part of allowing the plugin to be used in
conjunction with context and policy. We need the ability to pass the
token coming from the user over RPC within a service.

Allow serializing the user plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1459481
Change-Id: I3881cc59f66e01797cdbdc9c40ae454929675a4e

commit_message:
Fix variable name for dhcp-hosts file name

{{ hostname }} is not defined anywhere, and trying to use it results in
the following error:

  fatal: [node.example.com -> localhost] => One or more undefined variables: 'hostname' is undefined

The variable inventory_hostname is defined and is a reasonable name for
this file, so use that instead.

Change-Id: I6aebf7fd25c9fc279b42fab9414ede81c5afacf6

commit_message:
API: Add debug message for every API call

Added debug messages for each API call. It will helpful for debugging,
especially on gate.

This log message will be only print out when the request has body, and output
will be like follows:

Processing request: url: http://10.238.157.49:9511/v1/bays, POST, body:
{"name": "k8s", "discovery_url": null, "master_count": 1, "baymodel_id":
"e5534156-7b7d-4ddf-afe9-f4189a5e77fe", "node_count": "1",
"bay_create_timeout": null}

P.S. I would like to add it in routers, we'd better to LOG which controller
is called, but since we are inherited from pecan, we don't want so much
hacking to base class.

Closes-Bug: #1516464
Change-Id: I24543dfcb97a90b2849813ce7aaeb8904f7d50ca

commit_message:
Add "unreleased" release notes page

We need a release notes page to show notes for unreleased versions by
scanning the "current" branch. This ensures that notes files cannot be
merged if they break the releasenotes job.

Change-Id: Ifeb96a9c475c2f2b8fd1cac031c316b0846aa9eb
(cherry picked from commit 5373ba49b051e08d33f5d48a47434bd61cc5526e)

commit_message:
Adding 'messaging' as prefix for Zaqar commands

Due to the limitation of openstackclient, different services may
run into name conflict for similar functions. For example, Zaqar's
flavor and Nova's flavor. So we'd like to use 'messaging' as the
prefix for all Zaqar's commands.

Besides, to keep the back compatibility, the old commands will
still be kept for v1.

Change-Id: I718f06e9c611df02f7a7b479b3a50956de95ea61

commit_message:
Block oslo.versionedobjects 0.13.0

The 0.13.0 version contains If9a158fbd345b56b26ebbe2a0733db55f4929ea1
which is causing infinite recursion in nova's unit tests. Block
that version while a fix is being worked.

Depends-On: I786541e9b5e5ee0104bfdee3c76d7757c70f3348

Change-Id: I2fb61864e23278a134990b0b37c87fe84b8f2f3e

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

As per the release process changes for liberty and mitaka [1], the
reno tooling is being added to the repository for the purpose of
implementing on-going release note additions.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/078301.html

Note:
This patch is primarily for testing release note builds and has
therefore been modified from the original commit.

Change-Id: Ibbf4dc43b1fd5704a72cc7af82ddccfb1464926b
(cherry picked from commit 4effbbddae7123614737bd58f2927a5cd052e205)

commit_message:
update middlewarearchitecture.rst

The patch primarily adds some info about the auth_plugin, since
loading the plugin in the old way has been deprecated but no
information on how to use the `auth_plugin`.

This patch also take the chance to fix some typos and improve the
doc format.

Co-Authored-By: Brant Knudson <bknudson@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I931de73a97fa20eedc777a6ff41cf740e4a32584
Closes-Bug: #1490834

The XML comparisons were done using strings that were slightly
normalized by removing newlines. This isn't a safe way to do
XML comparison since XML documents that are represented
differently as strings can still be the same. For example, the
shortened namespace can be different or attributes can be in
different order.

XML comparisons should be done using the XML matcher so that

commit_message:
Use XML matcher

The XML comparisons were done using strings that were slightly
normalized by removing newlines. This isn't a safe way to do XML
comparison since XML documents that are represented differently as
strings can still be the same. For example, the shortened
namespace can be different or attributes can be in different order.

XML comparisons should be done using the XML matcher so that
differences in the exact representation are allowed.

Change-Id: Id26531eb0f55b45a257ea22eb7263524158f45f9

commit_message:
Add a executor backed conductor and have existing impl. use it

This adds a executor backed job dispatching base class
and has the existing blocking executor use it by running jobs
and dispatching jobs into a sync executor. It also allows
for dispatching jobs into a thread executor, or other executor
via a new '_executor_factory' method that can generate
executors (it can be overriden in the non-blocking executor
to provide your own executors instances).

This does alter the behavior in that now that jobs are dispatched
into an executor we no longer can immediatly know if a job was
dispatched and raised an exception or whether it will raise an
exception in the future, so we now alter the 'local_dispatched'
to just be a boolean that is used to determine if any dispatches
happened (failure or not).

Change-Id: I485770e8f4c85d3833892a453c9fb5168d8f0407

subject: Update documentation for automatic index creation
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-14 01:07:49.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/elasticsearch.rst'], 'message': 'Update documentation for automatic index creation

The current documentation mentions setting action.create_index to
disable automatic index creation, but the setting should be
action.auto_create_index.  The action.auto_create_index setting is
specified in elasticsearch docs such as this one:

http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-index_.html

Change-Id: I27e87d64a683a4ea1b4dbc0577ef44194dbb6873
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update documentation for automatic index creation

The current documentation mentions setting action.create_index to
disable automatic index creation, but the setting should be
action.auto_create_index.  The action.auto_create_index setting is
specified in elasticsearch docs such as this one:

http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-index_.html

Change-Id: I27e87d64a683a4ea1b4dbc0577ef44194dbb6873

commit_message:
Clean up hdisks after failed live migration

When there is a live migration failure that prevents the VM
from moving to the destination host, any hdisks created on the
destination host should be deleted. These hdisks are created
when we do the discovery operation for any volumes attached
to the VM via VSCSI.

Change-Id: I6e7f88ede68522c9f4788c549b8bfc84f7ae382a

hard to follow. This commit extracts this logic into its own class as

subject: Remove 'raise' in _get
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-16 14:06:16.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Remove 'raise' in _get

The affected code raises a KeyError to reach the except block, instead
of using normal code structure. Although try/except blocks are cheap,
actually throwing an exception takes quite a few cycles. Checking
config options is supposed to be very cheap so we should avoid
unnecessary performance hits like this.

Change-Id: I0de7919a651b42007526371ad8f3fe97a446afb6
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove 'raise' in _get

The affected code raises a KeyError to reach the except block, instead
of using normal code structure. Although try/except blocks are cheap,
actually throwing an exception takes quite a few cycles. Checking
config options is supposed to be very cheap so we should avoid
unnecessary performance hits like this.

Change-Id: I0de7919a651b42007526371ad8f3fe97a446afb6

commit_message:
Modify test case for broader coverage

This particular test as changed in this patch fails tox on local machines
where URL gets redirected by internet service provider. This was observed on
multiple machines running Linux VM on Mac and Windows. Also adding i18n for
message and parameterizing it.

* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override
* Remove setenv : We can just use the default as
  we don't need any extra environment variables
* Remove requirements.txt from deps, as this is
  already added automatically

Change-Id: Iad4623157750ca3808f5b2adb712814c98d824fa

commit_message:
Define entry points for filter factories for Paste Deployment

Define filter factories so other projects can reference them by name
and can take advantage of the python egg instead of referencing
by the direct path.

Change-Id: Id05c319c1d19261618471fa75983cf8020fc60b6
Closes-Bug: 1500509

subject: Make "Auth Token confirmed use of %s apis" debug level
revisions:

This pops up in ironic dsvm jobs. According to the guidelines,
INFO level is for operators to consume, and this seems to be
an implementation detail.

Change-Id: Ifbb10a961de91c7b3044c383c6fdabfed3d4e777
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make "Auth Token confirmed use of %s apis" debug level

This pops up in ironic dsvm jobs. According to the guidelines,
INFO level is for operators to consume, and this seems to be
an implementation detail.

Change-Id: Ifbb10a961de91c7b3044c383c6fdabfed3d4e777

commit_message:
Drop python26 jobs from oslo projects

Signal that we won't be worrying about py26 compatability
any more from now on.
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-oslo-library-updates

Change-Id: I756df0804c9287306e9fb2e41daefee6bdd3ceb3

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-29 21:48:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Basic tables now inherit from Bootstrap Theme

Horizon tables had many hardcoded padding and colors in them, which
made them not theme-ready.  This patch vets all the old table styles
for their current usage (if any) and reimplemented the necessary
rules to inherit from the theme.

There were a number of styles that were obviously not being used any
longer. These rules were removed.  There were also many rules that
were very difficult to determine their lineage, as the scss lacks
much needed commentary on why some styles exist (if they are working
around specific browser issues, or usability glitches).

An few examples of some of these removed styles include:
 * th.narrow
 * td.select
 * th span.required:after

This patch does not include refactor of the dropdowns or inline edit.

Immediate Improvements:
 * Table Actions are now all consistent heights
 * The cursor is a pointer ONLY on sortable rows now
 * The column sort indicator is now an icon font, therefore high def
 * table_header height no longer hardcoded, can grow with theme
 * Slow waiting cursor style using global selector * removed
 * Many dead styles were removed!!
 * Hovering on status_unknown rows now keep proper color

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards
Change-Id: I4a904704926dc50010ad480539db828eff559fa0

commit_message:
Basic tables now inherit from Bootstrap Theme

Horizon tables had many hardcoded padding and colors in them, which
made them not theme-ready.  This patch vets all the old table styles
for their current usage (if any) and reimplemented the necessary
rules to inherit from the theme.

There were a number of styles that were obviously not being used any
longer. These rules were removed.  There were also many rules that
were very difficult to determine their lineage, as the scss lacks
much needed commentary on why some styles exist (if they are working
around specific browser issues, or usability glitches, etc).

A few examples of some of these removed styles include:
 * th.narrow
 * td.select
 * th span.required:after

This patch does not include refactor of the dropdowns or inline edit.

Immediate Improvements:
 * Table Actions are now all consistent heights
 * The cursor is a pointer ONLY on sortable rows now
 * The column sort indicator is now an icon font, therefore high def
 * table_header height no longer hardcoded, can grow with theme
 * Slow waiting cursor style using global selector * removed
 * Many dead styles were removed!!
 * Hovering on status_unknown rows now keeps proper color

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards
Change-Id: I4a904704926dc50010ad480539db828eff559fa0

commit_message:
Add "unreleased" release notes page

We need a release notes page to show notes for unreleased versions by
scanning the "current" branch. This ensures that notes files cannot be
merged if they break the releasenotes job.

Change-Id: Ifeb96a9c475c2f2b8fd1cac031c316b0846aa9eb

commit_message:
install database when collector is enabled.

Currently, if we run devstack for compute node, ceilometer-collector
service will be disabled on compute node, but the database is still
installed.

This patch makes sure that database is installed only when collector
is enabled.

Also add check for coordinate and hypervisor requirements.

Change-Id: Ib3614d2e698403c24ad299d95ef42c81815fa76e
Closes-Bug: #1508518

commit_message:
xenapi_device_id integer, expected string

XAPI expects to get a string, not an integer, so we convert it to a
string before assigning it to the rec dictionary.

The current test examples use a device_id of "0002". To keep consistency,
minimize changes, and prevent introducing further bugs, the string is
zero padded to maintain this format.

Change-Id: I1a6b11ced0dc053903e91378203f5afb5740fa79
Closes-bug: #1503423

commit_message:
Make js unit tests voting on openstack-health

This commit removes the non-voting flag from the openstack-health js
unit test job. We've gotten the state of those tests to a good place,
so we should be able to make things voting so we don't slide backwards
there.

Change-Id: I6a8cd2bdd4a2627569f840593487e0e7369f51ff

commit_message:
Fix to preserve double dashes of command line option in HTML.

This patch fixes the ReST doc so that generated HTML file can keep
double dashes of command line option by enclosing the option in double
back quote such as ``--standalone`` and ``--debug``.

Change-Id: Icf25ff8ddfb7c04d82d6e63885cad0ec62e86cba

subject: Update the 'I want to try this' use case manifest
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-15 21:46:44.000000000', 'files': ['USECASES.md'], 'message': "Update the 'I want to try this' use case manifest

The 'I want to try this' manifest provided in USECASES.md no longer
cleanly applies.  This patch updates the manifest so that it passes
syntax checks and applies cleanly on a new Ubuntu 14.04 virtual machine
with a second disk located at /dev/vdb.

Additional changes are required to make this manifest apply cleanly to
RHEL or CentOS machines.  Those changes are outlined in bug #1411424,
and I believe they are separate issues that should be addressed outside
of this sample use case.

Change-Id: I3f93381ca05d5b73fae35121c475356c59a5ab2a
Closes-Bug: 1411424
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update the 'I want to try this' use case manifest

The 'I want to try this' manifest provided in USECASES.md no longer
cleanly applies.  This patch updates the manifest so that it passes
syntax checks and applies cleanly on a new Ubuntu 14.04 virtual machine
with a second disk located at /dev/vdb.

Additional changes are required to make this manifest apply cleanly to
RHEL or CentOS machines.  Those changes are outlined in bug #1411424,
and I believe they are separate issues that should be addressed outside
of this sample use case.

Change-Id: I3f93381ca05d5b73fae35121c475356c59a5ab2a

[{'created': '2015-10-15 00:35:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Log all resource events during overcloud deploy

This change switches the overcloud deploy stack polling with event
list polling. This uses the same technique as the recently added
heat stack-create --poll mode: Ib7d35b66521f0ccca8544fd18fb70e04eaf98e5a

There is a CREATE_(COMPLETE|FAILED) event generated when the actual
stack is done so this is used to decide when to stop polling.

Also, every time there is an event it is printed to the screen in log
style. This would give the user an indication that something is
happening, which is better than staring at nothing for minutes (hours).

commit_message:
Log all resource events during overcloud deploy

This change switches the overcloud deploy stack polling with event
list polling. This uses the same technique as the recently added
heat stack-create --poll mode: Ib7d35b66521f0ccca8544fd18fb70e04eaf98e5a

There is a (CREATE|UPDATE)_(COMPLETE|FAILED) event generated when the stack
operation is complete, so this is used to decide when to stop polling.

Also, every time there is an event it is printed to the screen in log
style. This would give the user an indication that something is
happening, which is better than staring at nothing for minutes (hours).

On stack update, the oldest event from the previous operation is discovered and
that is used for the marker so that only new events are logged.

Change-Id: I8951b0b924db769961aa67e654fcbd774d3e7787

commit_message:
Adds puppet-manila to install from source list

For DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet_modules=source, the change that added
manila https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186406/ didn't add it to
the environment.d script which exports the individual module env
vars like DIB_INSTALLTYPE_puppet-manila

I think this may explain the errors we get in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/188137

Change-Id: If0b08df9f09f62a04e6cff11c451599312d9a09b

commit_message:
Added additional upgrade process

This change makes sure that all of the secrets that may be required
for a kilo upgrade are properly generated. The change documents the
new step which is also added to the general run-upgrade.sh script.

Change-Id: I3b893d804947eab558a5de824c3776b661a2aaaa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use Chrome for Protractor E2E testing.

This reverts to using Chrome with direct connect for E2E tests,
as build nodes should already have a configured virtual X server
for npm jobs. This also removes the need for Selenium, which
should speed up environment setup.

PhantomJS appears to be somewhat unreliable for E2E testing, and
does not allow for some extra features, such as reading from
browser console logs.

Change-Id: I77a4fa86469c96af5494dc8118217d47abbc6dea

[{'created': '2015-11-10 17:13:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: Raise DiskNotFound for missing disk device

If volume detach fails after reconfiguring the VM to remove volume
vmdk then it will not be possible to detach the volume again. This
is because the VMware driver fails the detach operation by raising
StorageError when it finds that the volume disk device is missing.
Due to this, the volume state will remain 'in-use'.

The compute manager expects the driver to raise DiskNotFound if the
disk is missing during detach operation. It ignores the exception
and allows the detach to complete. This patch fixes the problem with
the VMware driver by throwing DiskNotFound instead of StorageError
if the volume disk device is missing.

Change-Id: I4074d240a3468534c0a269f6cd160f399e8fa18c
Closes-Bug: #1514910
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-16 05:03:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': "VMware: Raise DiskNotFound for missing disk device

If volume detach fails after reconfiguring the VM to remove volume
vmdk then it will not be possible to detach the volume again. This
is because the VMware driver fails the detach operation by raising
StorageError when it finds that the volume disk device is missing.
Due to this, the volume state will remain 'in-use'.

The compute manager expects the driver to raise DiskNotFound if the
disk is missing during detach operation. It ignores the exception
and allows the detach to complete. This patch fixes the problem with
the VMware driver by throwing DiskNotFound instead of StorageError

Change-Id: I4074d240a3468534c0a269f6cd160f399e8fa18c

", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
VMware: Raise DiskNotFound for missing disk device

If volume detach fails after reconfiguring the VM to remove volume
vmdk then it will not be possible to detach the volume again. This
is because the VMware driver fails the detach operation by raising
StorageError when it finds that the volume disk device is missing.
Due to this, the volume state will remain 'in-use'.

The compute manager expects the driver to raise DiskNotFound if the
disk is missing during detach operation. It ignores the exception
and allows the detach to complete. This patch fixes the problem with
the VMware driver by throwing DiskNotFound instead of StorageError
if the volume disk device is missing.

Change-Id: I4074d240a3468534c0a269f6cd160f399e8fa18c
Closes-Bug: #1514910

commit_message:
Generate a unique DeployIdentifier on updates

This patch updates 'overcloud deploy' commands so that
updates (re-running deploy on an existing stack) generate
a unique DeployIdentifier parameter. By passing an unique
DeployIdentifier parameter into the overcloud stack we
force all puppet config tasks (which are idempotent
and safe to exec multiple times) again.

We've had several issues with puppet not-rerunning on
a variety of config related changes and additionally recieved
user feedback that not re-running all puppet deployments on
an update is confusing.

Change-Id: Ia659181872a6537cc169f1d1531ebf5d36160183
Closes-bug: #1505430
Depends-On: Ic352ddd30807dc378e5e7b6c396bc53f5d6d5622

commit_message:
Delete kube-register

1. kubelet can automatically register nodes, so we don't need to
register nodes.
2. When we remove a node from the cluster, the nova instance is
terminated. So the instance has no stop process to run unregister
script. Heat has a spec [1] to add stop deletion policy now. After
this function is merged, I will add unregister script back.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243012/

Change-Id: I9b1ea0eda74f9bfba8b87c67c2bd063c62460336
Partial-Bug: #1511570

commit_message:
Fix error in starting Docker on k8s minion

Previously, the docker service was not starting on k8s minions.
This patch updates the Docker STORAGE_OPTIONS on minions with the
correct settings.

Change-Id: I20e6c3cadbe0826dbb04ce62532af002505222a7
Closes-Bug: 1507374

commit_message:
cells is a sad panda about scheduler hints

The new test_schedule_to_all_nodes test fails in some epic ways in
cells. Not really worth debugging, this is a new test and had just
exposed another cells / devstack issue. Just skip the test.

Conflicts:
	devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc

Change-Id: Icc71e36f4ecb015dff9e806caacd31262f7e17f7
(cherry picked from commit 876679c08f05eaa2a90b1f053b65b78a0af433df)

commit_message:
Store attributes of plugins in a separate table

This is redesign of plugins architecture in order to store
the plugin's attributes in a separate table, not in cluster
attributes, so it will be possible to remove connection between
plugin and cluster when a plugin gets deleted.

Added ability to work with different versions of a plugin.
User can choose the preferred version in UI.

The test "test_plugin_generator" was removed because no longer
relevant.

Closes-Bug: #1440046
Implements: blueprint store-plugins-attributes

Change-Id: I52115f130bf1c7c80c66e18d0bf9f7acb16dd56c

Added driver minimum requirements and features doc

This document consists of a list and explanation of minimum features
a driver must implement to be accepted into Manila code base.

[{'created': '2014-02-18 23:45:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for backup encryption metadata

This modification allows the encryption key UUID field, which
has been added to the volume table, to remain valid when encrypted
volumes are backed up and then restored, which enables the restored
volume to be accessible and encrypted.  This is related to patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39573/, except that it uses the
backup metadata support recently added in patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51900/ rather than modifying the
backup api.

commit_message:
Add support for backup encryption metadata

This modification allows the encryption key UUID field, which
has been added to the volume table, to remain valid when encrypted
volumes are backed up and then restored, which enables the restored
volume to be accessible and encrypted.  This is related to patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39573/, except that it uses the
backup metadata support recently added in patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51900/ rather than modifying the
backup api.

Change-Id: Ib91f8275271e6bd4f2d9e17499d16ec13bca2b84
Implements: blueprint backup-support-for-encrypted-volumes
DocImpact

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-29 12:26:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Added method is_supported to check API microversions

Right now to check if some part of code supports
requested microversion developer usually:

 1. get a microverison from request.
 2. create instance of class APIVersionRequest
    with requested microversion.

commit_message:
Added method is_supported to check API microversions

Right now to check if some part of code supports
requested microversion developer usually:

 1. get a microversion from request.
 2. create instance of class APIVersionRequest
    with requested microversion.
 3. compare these two objects.

This check takes at least 2 lines and looks ugly.
Sometimes developers create unnecessary class fields
to store object APIVersionRequest with requested microversion.

To make nova code more readable and simple method
'is_supported' was created.

Microversion check with this method takes only one line
and code looks more beautiful.

Change-Id: I9078cfa1afad8b6b09583dac87fa757a0cc32daa

with python's builtin json module.

commit_message:
Repair and rename test_is_volume_backed_instance_no_bdms()

The function did not assert the result of
is_volume_backed_instance(), which is fixed here.  The function uses
a mockup of get_by_instance_uuid() that returns an empty block device
map, instead of calling block_device_make_list() with an explicit
empty bdm as in another test case.  Therefore the function is renamed
to test_is_volume_backed_instance_empty_bdm_by_uuid().

Change-Id: I469f3a6ee88f1acd42bd0df7d0881e20bf68fd0c

Use ObjectVersionChecker fixture from oslo.versionedobjects

The fixture in the o.vo library allows us to remove duplicate test
code in Nova, so let's use that.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-07 14:30:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ScalityVolume:fix how remote FS mount is detected

A new version of Scality Ring doesn't have a 'sys" directory at the
root level of the Scality (distributed) filesystem. But the
LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver in Nova relies on the presence of this
'sys' directory to detect whether the Scality Filesystem has been
properly mounted. This means that LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver doesn"t
detect that the filesystem was already mounted.

Fix this be introducing a more robust way to detect that the remote
FS is already mounted, based on what's in /proc/mounts

While we are at it, also fix the unit tests because they had bad side
effects (they would create a TempDir with a file in it).

Change-Id: I0997f123aaed2f2c002c8084d6aab40e2f0dd5b8
Closes-Bug: #1482287
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-12 15:03:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'ScalityVolume:fix how remote FS mount is detected

While we are at it, also fix the unit tests because they had bad side

", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-11-09 16:23:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/volume/test_scality.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/volume/scality.py'], 'message': "ScalityVolume:fix how remote FS mount is detected

A new version of Scality Ring doesn't have a 'sys' directory at the

commit_message:
ScalityVolume:fix how remote FS mount is detected

A new version of Scality Ring doesn't have a 'sys' directory at the
root level of the Scality (distributed) filesystem. But the
LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver in Nova relies on the presence of this
'sys' directory to detect whether the Scality Filesystem has been
properly mounted. This means that LibvirtScalityVolumeDriver doesn't
detect that the filesystem was already mounted.

Fix this be introducing a more robust way to detect that the remote
FS is already mounted, based on what's in /proc/mounts

While we are at it, also fix the unit tests because they had bad side
effects (they would create a TempDir with a file in it).

Change-Id: I0997f123aaed2f2c002c8084d6aab40e2f0dd5b8
Closes-Bug: #1482287

commit_message:
Raise error if bad WWPNs used on connect

Raises an error if the connect volume is unable to find the appropriate
Virtual I/O Server for a WWPN.  This wraps into a proper Volume Attach
exception, so that the manager can handle the task state properly.

Change-Id: I6c98d0eb234a0e159907f68f8bd4b78255c90052
Closes-Bug: 1515357
(cherry picked from commit beacd00d1ec3e86d3b60672930d33fa17ba90634)

commit_message:
fix grenade tempest defaults

All grenade jobs need to run tempest, and it's forced on in
devstack-gate. However, at some point a job specified
DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST=0 and it was cargo culted through this file. We
should set it to 1 to reflect reality and cause less confusion for
newcomers.

Change-Id: Ic146998587855d082321da872e9abccadcf35c15

documented at a minimal level. We need to be able to
support a lightweight workflow that can grow as needed
to support more comprehensive reviews for feature requests.

This patch provides that initial documentation. It is loosely
based on reading many mailing list threads and on the latest
updates to the Neutron RFE / spec template process.

commit_message:
Document Feature Request and Bug Workflow

Searchlight needs the feature request process and bug workflow to be
documented.

Our process is meant to allow users to express their desires for new features
using Launchpad blueprints. A quick review of blueprints can be done and
they can turn into features only requiring additional specifications should
the need arise.

This patch provides the initial process documentation. It is loosely
based on reading many mailing list threads on specs, launchpad,
and on the latest updates to the Neutron RFE / spec template process [1].

[1] http://www.siliconloons.com/posts/2015-06-01-new-neutron-rfe-process/

Change-Id: I30a7f3d4ac13d1fb621c9bdd4001a1831f7c0d16

commit_message:
Add breadcrumbs to final details pages

This patch adds the breadcrumb navigation to the final few details
pages: Users, Load Balancers, Projects, Hypervisors.

- Small redesigns the Load Balancer page to make the Member/Monitor
listings more readable
- Small redesign of Monitor Details to make Pools list more readable
- Adds missing translation wrapper to subnets breadcrumb

At this point, all Details pages should now use the breadcrumb format,
with the exception of Network Details, which is waiting on
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1416838

Closes-Bug: 1413823
Closes-Bug: 1100318
Change-Id: I3a1de6d24dfd49ae2e28107e9de76bbd9d972162

* given name already exists

commit_message:
Enhance test_metrics

Test more details in create metrics and list metrics.
Added timestamp_to_iso and timestamp_to_iso_millis functions in helpers.py
instead of using deprecated functions timeutils.iso8601_from_timestamp and timeutils.isotime.

commit_message:
Full validation of TOSCA templates

Modify the exception handling in TOSCA Parser so that all possible
validation errors are captured during parsing (instead of stopping
the parsing when the first error is encountered) and reported when
parsing is done.

Reporting the line number of each error will be implemented in a
separate patch.

Change-Id: I032c371fe0a73cdf901599ed4ae113f9157d8a1b
Partially-Implements: blueprint tosca-tpl-cli-validator

commit_message:
Tidy engine and datasource mgr refer in harness

The policy engine and datasource mgr instance are created in
harness.create(), they are transmited for all API model when
cage.createservice(), but not all API models need both of them,
tidy the object refer, only present in arguments when the API
model really need.

Change-Id: Ic2d8e93d71d6e19e5f5fdad3ddc7928ec311de08

Convert exceptions to MigrationPreCheckError

Exceptions returned during pre live migration should be
MigrationPreCheckError exceptions otherwise the instance will
be set to error state.

Closes-Bug: #1513643

commit_message:
Remove '/test_runs' api endpoint

The api endpoint '/test_runs' is not being used by any page. As of
today, getting all this data from the database at once will simply end
up in a server error. Neither a browser nor the Apache server are ready
to handle this much data.
If we really want to have this, it will be better filtering it.

Change-Id: I3eee8b76e8a87c129592edce37cb199310a8cf1c

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 15:54:06.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datalog/test_compiler.py'], 'message': 'Fixed bugs in dependency graph tests

Previously we were using assertTrue when we should have
been using assertEqual, which meant the tests were not running.

Fortunately, the tests were broken but the code was not, since the
tests pass with the fix in place.

Change-Id: I6e26502462f752143c526c68c64d59ee0124f783
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fixed bugs in dependency graph tests

Previously we were using assertTrue when we should have
been using assertEqual, which meant the tests were not running.

Fortunately, the tests were broken but the code was not, since the
tests pass with the fix in place.

Change-Id: I6e26502462f752143c526c68c64d59ee0124f783

commit_message:
WIP create_export only call when not attached

This patch changes how the volume manager calls create_export.
Currently the volume manager's initialize_connection always calls
create_export.   This should only be called when the volume isn't
already attached to the host.  There is no need to export the volume
if it's already attached.

Change-Id: I0637e57b1d3390c547a9745ce193a89c9459d1c0
TODO: create a bug for this?

commit_message:
Remove duplicate server.kill on test shutdown

start_service adds a fixture which calls kill on cleanup, so calling
it a second time is redundant.

Change-Id: If24178f636541f34b434d13f439e60184d0b1ab1

commit_message:
Fix pci_stats logging in resource tracker

In the resource tracker the pci stats is show in
the log like pci_stats=PciDevicePoolList(objects=[PciDevicePool]
the patch fix it to be logged as
pci_stats=[PciDevicePool(count=7,numa_node=None,product_id='1004',
           tags={physical_network='physnet1'},vendor_id='15b3')]

Closes-Bug: #1513467
Change-Id: I9434bb5cf0ed9eca291df6f4a8b8568b7c3ff4eb

commit_message:
Fuel plugin builder accepts 'master' as task role

Schema for all versions was updated to accept also 'master' string as
deployment task role, in addition to previous possible values:
'*' string and array of strings matching '^[0-9a-zA-Z_-]+$' regex.

Closes-bug: #1510354
DocImpact

Change-Id: Iaaf17bf42efb27beda23cf6a46137e380f8569c0

commit_message:
Add 'volume_type' parameter to instance create

Add an optional Cinder volume-type parameter to the instance
create command.
Also allow for 'volume_type' parameter in cluster create.

Change-Id: Ie36601e517156f20f95dfd6c4b6358d268cb4b80

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.7 support

Django 1.7 support ends in December 2015
(https://www.djangoproject.com/download/#supported-versions), so it
will not be supported by Mitaka release.

This patch removes many of the deprecation warnings:-

`RedirectView.permanent` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/ref/class-based-views/base/

`url` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.5 notes for the url and ssi template tag change

`django.forms.utils` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.9 notes

`firstof` change:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.8/internals/deprecation/
See version 1.8 notes for cycle and firstof template tags

Change-Id: If546c087e73d189daa92e5bd63f0533fcf19089f
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-dj17

commit_message:
[Verify] Refactoring HtmlOutput

There is no reason to use OOP for one simple method. This patch replaces
class HtmlOutput with simple function "generate_report".

Also, it adds an improvement for skip reason: now ID of a bug is replaced
by the launchpad link to it in HTML report.

Change-Id: Ia75578a67a1fe626b80b877bbda659b5e6070ef0

[{'created': '2015-11-13 21:54:36.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_api/v2/reference/helpers.py'], 'message': "Fix query param parsing

If falcon receives multiple query parameters with the same name, it
creates a list of values for that name. This checks for a list and
takes the first value (to match the java api's behavior)

Change-Id: I660846494d4d3bc24c2d870e9b88d0fd2fcc7fcf
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix query param parsing

If falcon receives multiple query parameters with the same name, it
creates a list of values for that name. This checks for a list and
takes the first value (to match the java api's behavior)

Change-Id: I660846494d4d3bc24c2d870e9b88d0fd2fcc7fcf

commit_message:
Fix PolicyException on restarting service

Current behaviour allows to create two tables with multiple arities
if one of the arity is 0. But loading the same rules
on restarting the service fails. This commit is to fix the same.

Change-Id: I133532658c421d09640419cef7857cf5eaa864d9
Closes-Bug:#1515890

commit_message:
Migrate to tempest_lib : exceptions

In order to be independent from changes in Tempest. Congress should
use the tempest_lib as much as possible. Exception classes are
already copied to tempest_lib.

Change-Id: I6c11acd96d5c508d8c84d612e7ce328e45f81549

commit_message:
Update neutron-debug to use stevedore aliases

Updating neutron-debug as it is importing interface driver classes
directly and not using the load_driver_interface method.
Also adds unit tests for the neutron-debug tool.

Change-Id: Icf095b2182225e63e85d849d83c2cb36b8a39217
Closes-Bug: #1504536
(cherry picked from commit c4e0574da1c7f30f9a153e01e7793926454cf2c7)

commit_message:
XenAPI:Fix problems to support xenserver+neutron

The lack of a CI for XenAPI + Neutron has meant this support has been
broken over time. This is set of one-off fixes that are needed to
reintroduce support while we work towards getting a CI functional

Related-Bug: #1495423
Change-Id: Id41fdc77c155756bda9e2e9ac0446a49f06f0603

Based on this: I58e69ddced3ca7fad0a9df8c7f52f5f5c077a844 it turned

commit_message:
Remove unused exceptions from glance

Based on this: I58e69ddced3ca7fad0a9df8c7f52f5f5c077a844 it turned
out that some of glance_store exceptions will never be generated.
Also it turns out that some glance exception are not raised any
where in code. So we can safely delete them from Glance.

Change-Id: I945bee4ceeec42065a78e2147f278b264c5217a2

commit_message:
Correct list_join function

Heat supports 'list_join' function to join one or more
lists of strings in Liberty release. But when we resolve
the function, we pop some arguments, this introduced
errors if resolve the snippet again when updating a resource.

This patch correct the behavior of 'list_join' function,
also refactor some codes for the functions of Kilo/Liberty.

Change-Id: Ia67a0171261ca1a864fe11f7d61c3bf5ef801040
Closes-Bug: #1513060

commit_message:
enginefacade: 'certificate' and 'pci_device'

Use enginefacade in 'certificate' and 'pci_device' sections.

Implements: blueprint new-oslodb-enginefacade

Co-Authored-By: Sergey Nikitin <snikitin@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Hypervisor support matrix: define pause & unpause

Clarify in the hypervisor support matrix docs that "Stop instance CPUs"
is the same as "pause", and that "Resume instance CPUs" is the same as
"unpause".

Change-Id: I26d6a065dd239f376b57ae44d34276a994b30b2e
Closes-Bug: #1511487

commit_message:
libvirt: support snapshots with parallels virt_type

It's not currently possible to create snapshots if you
use libvirt driver with parallels virt_type. First of all
it's because snapshot_extract method is not implemented
in imagebackend.Ploop class. There are also issues in
utils.extract_snapshot, find_disk and get_disk_type.

This patch solves all those issues, so snapshots will
work with parallels virt_type.

DocImpact: parallels now supports snapshot
Closes-bug: 1484074
Implements: blueprint ploop-snapshot-support

Change-Id: Id3b5bfc946a858f7e6ed710f2b44c7ca63a10723

There are only three supported values for the servicegroup_driver option
as listed in the code and the help text of the option. We can enforce this
with the choices kwarg built into StrOpt so we don't need the explicit
KeyError checking in the code, a ValueError is raised if an invalid value

commit_message:
Use oslo.config choices kwarg with StrOpt for servicegroup_driver

There are only three supported values for the servicegroup_driver option
as listed in the code and the help text of the option. We can enforce this
with the choices kwarg built into StrOpt so we don't need the explicit
KeyError checking in the code, a ValueError is raised if an invalid value
is specified in nova.conf.

Change-Id: Iaf419cc4f06e26bb0836661460883710df3c22e6

commit_message:
Fixed issue with 429 code for Tempest results

We fixed issue with TestRail API 429 errors for
SWARM tests, but for Tempest results we need to
use minimum API requests and upload all results
with only one bulk API request.

I sent support request to TestRail support team
and they provided me the information how we can
change our API calls to TestRail to avoid any
issues in the future.

Change-Id: I7d8ffc3238eefe186f9ec904d8dca153527261ab
Related-Bug: #1514797

commit_message:
Install 'dpkg-dev' before regenerating repository

Currently 'dpkg-scanpackages' tool is provided by 'dpkg-dev'
package (see bug #1515563), so it must be installed for
tests which regenerate Ubuntu repository on master node.

Change-Id: Ieb2968d428b098bdd5457dd298aebe0131562f26
Closes-bug: #1516662

", 'number': 20}, {'created': '2015-10-22 12:59:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Verify] Adding creation of network resources to Tempest context

Tempest creates private network resources for all tests by default.
We, of course, can use it, but it will not work in some cases. For example,
when a cloud has a few networks that are visible in all tenants. In this
case Tempest tests will fail with error "Multiple possible networks found".
The approach when we create private network resources before test run and
configure the fixed_network_name option allows us to avoid such failures.
Of course, it's not very optimal to create private network resources for
each Tempest run, but it will work for any clouds without mentioned failures.
Also, there is a possibility not to create private network resources. In this
case we have to configure the fixed_network_name option manually and context
will not create the resources.

Unit tests for new methods and missing unit tests were added.

Change-Id: I487806fe9a8ccd8528922cfaa2700df30961ef9b

', 'number': 23}, {'created': '2015-11-09 20:06:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Verify] Adding creation of network resources to Tempest context

Tempest creates private network resources for all tests by default.
We, of course, can use it, but it will not work in some cases. For example,
when a cloud has a few networks that are visible in all tenants. In this
case Tempest tests will fail with error "Multiple possible networks found".
The approach when we create private network resources before test run and
configure the fixed_network_name option allows us to avoid such failures.
Also, there is a possibility not to create private network resources.
In this case we have to configure the fixed_network_name option manually
in the Tempest config file and then the Tempest context will not create
network resources.

Unit tests for new methods and missing unit tests were added.

Change-Id: I487806fe9a8ccd8528922cfaa2700df30961ef9b
', 'number': 24}, {'created': '2015-11-10 12:52:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[Verify] Adding creation of network resources to Tempest context

Tempest creates private network resources for all tests by default.
If a cloud has some shared networks, many Tempest tests will fail with
the following error:

    "Multiple possible networks found."

To avoid this issue we have to configure the fixed_network_name option
in the Tempest config file. So this patch proposes the following solution:

    if the cloud doesn't have any shared networks, the default behavior
    defined in Tempest will be used and Tempest itself will manage network
    resources;

    if the cloud has some shared networks, we will create our own shared
    network and specify its name in the Tempest config file;

    if the cloud has some shared networks and a user will configure the fixed_
    network_name option in the Tempest config file manually, in this case our
    own shared network will not be created and the specified network in the
    tempest.conf file will be used by Tempest.

The exec_wrapper function was added.
Unit tests for new methods and missing unit tests were added.

Change-Id: I487806fe9a8ccd8528922cfaa2700df30961ef9b

    if the cloud doesn't have any shared networks, the default behavior
    defined in Tempest will be used and Tempest itself will manage network
    resources;

    if the cloud has some shared networks, we will create our own shared
    network and specify its name in the Tempest config file;

    if user configures the fixed_network_name option in the tempest.conf
    file manually, then we don't need to do anything.

Unit tests for new methods and missing unit tests were added.

commit_message:
[Verify] Adding creation of network resources to Tempest context

Tempest creates private network resources for all tests by default.
If a cloud has some shared networks, many Tempest tests will fail with
the following error:

    "Multiple possible networks found."

To avoid this issue we have to configure the fixed_network_name option
in the Tempest config file. So this patch proposes the following solution:

    if the cloud doesn't have any shared networks, the default behavior
    defined in Tempest will be used and Tempest itself will manage network
    resources;

    if the cloud has some shared networks, we will create our own shared
    network and specify its name in the Tempest config file;

    if user configures the fixed_network_name option in the tempest.conf
    file manually, then we don't need to do anything.

Unit tests for new methods and missing unit tests were added.

Change-Id: I487806fe9a8ccd8528922cfaa2700df30961ef9b

commit_message:
Remove setting API_RATE_LIMIT in localrc

Thanks to me in the past, present me gets to remove API_RATE_LIMIT
since it's no longer valid. I hope future me can somehow profit from
this.

commit_message:
Remove ironic-fa-deploy RPM package from mirror

Since we are not going to deploy OpenStack under CentOS for now,
we can remove ironic-fa-deploy RPM package from repo

improve utils.execute function

New keyword argument: `logged'. Log the stdout and stderr
of the command. Useful for debugging.

commit_message:
Remove cached debs from the image

debs cached by APT are useless after the chroot has been built,
remove them to make image smaller (=> faster provisioning).

Closes-Bug: #1514389

Change-Id: I5ca34ae3b540b1b63e4b0c1dc92b78da2442c1ee

commit_message:
Extend list benchmarks for ceilometer

Existing benchmarks which process a list of resources and meters
are updated via new context and adding new configured query
parameters.

It allows to find a weak places in requesting ceilometer
data and extend count of scenarios which use a ceilometer.

Change-Id: Ifbb77915267f7e339ea7adbd9dae34ca59acb78d

commit_message:
Sheepdog: Retrieve Config Info from specified group

The current sheepdogdriver simply gets Config Info from default
group of cinder config file, so we can run only one sheepdog cluster
as cinder backend. This patch fixes the problem by retrieving Config
Info from specified config group.

Change-Id: Icc8c8945bba0fcded83ff01e302b04a0e62c039f
Closes-Bug: #1514353

commit_message:
Remove unused scrub variables in barbican.conf

In /etc/barbican/barbican.conf, there are entries for a scrubber. There
are no scrubbers implemented for barbican so I am deleting the unused vars.

Change-Id: I61fe6a68a8155b261a20c85d7ef09be10a62151e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-18 19:32:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "libvirt: Don't attempt to convert initrd images.

Fetching kernel or initrd images used the same code
path as main images. This should not be the case as
these should never be resized, and should always be
in 'raw' format.

Kernel and inird images are now fetched directly
without any checks for types and bypassing any
attempted resizes or conversions.

Closes-Bug: #1497293
Change-Id: I9ab0391bb681185e8fe236698f5721d6cf25689b

commit_message:
libvirt: Don't attempt to convert initrd images.

Fetching kernel or initrd images used the same code
path as main images. This should not be the case as
these should never be resized, and should always be
in 'raw' format.

Kernel and inird images are now fetched directly
without any checks for types and bypassing any
attempted resizes or conversions.

Closes-Bug: #1497293
Change-Id: I9ab0391bb681185e8fe236698f5721d6cf25689b

commit_message:
Use openstackclient in swift exercises

With the release of osc 1.8.0, swift support has been expanded and
we can now remove references to the swift CLI from this exercise
file. Also made minor improvements to comments.

commit_message:
Fix limited retype support for rbd

The limited support for retyping of rbd volumes fails due to the
way the characteristics of the two volume types are compared: it
is assumed that the 'diff' dictionary is empty if the two volume
types do not differ. 'diff', however, contains value tuples for
the QoS, encryption, and extra_specs keys, irrespective of whether
or not they differ between the two types.
The current patch loops over the keys in the 'diff' dictionary and
compares the tuples.

Change-Id: I2ca42cf1c6f1236240d1a4d5f3a311316264e4a2
Closes-Bug: #1514775

commit_message:
Fixed haproxy backend config issue

The change updates the haproxy configs to use backends with a
default of an empty array. This is needed to ensure that the backends
are not being assumed to have some value. In the current system if an
inventory item did not exist the rendered backend would be a jinja
string which would cause the haproxy play to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1513455

Change-Id: I221dbd910c75c2e41c98a33e1c38c7f69718b544
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Can not set auth_endpoint in runtime

In rumtime castellan should be able to set auth_endpoint using options.set_defaults()
which is critical for application to be able to adjust endpoint in runtime.
https://bugs.launchpad.net/castellan/+bug/1515388

Change-Id: Ie918dcc4d28ec3507559e1b0c218995f6809c364
Closes-Bug: 1515388

commit_message:
Modified devref documents for more clarity.

Below issues are addressed as part of this patch:
 - Fixed formatting of hyperlinks.
 - Elaborated examples.
 - Modified contributor list.

Co-Authored-By: Mohankumar <nmohankumar1011@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ice32bbe755ffc31eccd1b8e4c40351359e1a06c6

commit_message:
Add reno for release notes management

Mostly cargo-culted from I9549e6b491b26232f4dac900b0bf05f10eb0e30a.

Note that reno automatically inserts version numbers; liberty.rst is
sufficient for intermediate release models.

Change-Id: Ic700d719242b17532b0b43a68b7eff507cb3a43c

commit_message:
Release openstack-doc-tools 0.32

The release is needed to publish translated Installation Guides, those
were generated wrongly.

This release contains also various smaller fixes.

Change-Id: I679f573ac18c8259e7032ac251615d10b6769e20

commit_message:
Switch to using neutron.common.utils:replace_file()

neutron.agent.linux.utils:replace_file() and
neutron.common.utils:replace_file() have same functionality.

This is the 1st patch in the series of 4 patches.
It modifies neutron.common.utils:replace_file(),
so it can be used by all components as a replacement
for neutron.agent.linux.utils:replace_file().
New keyword parameter 'file_mode=0o644' is added
to neutron.common.utils:replace_file().

Partial-bug: #1504477
Change-Id: Id1a7f1236786e8606c91bb9925cd9ac8e95892b3

commit_message:
Add documentation for keystone tokens

This serves as a very general introduction for keystone's token providers. We
can use this to link to other, more specific token documents.

Change-Id: I51a39c1830b9d9db5e4a7012a79fcc482537ebde

commit_message:
bump oslo.config upper-constraint

oslo.config 2.5.0 added support for more validation of options such as
enforcing type on ListOpts. gnocchi uses this feature so to allow proper
use and testing of gnocchi in gate, it'd be good to bump constraint

Change-Id: I97f538aafbbb2689b6714ab6fe1453c407ab4195

subject: liberty: release oslo.log 1.11.1
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-28 19:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/liberty/oslo.log.yaml'], 'message': 'liberty: release oslo.log 1.11.1

This is to release 83dd60562fa79d31337e9b9ecec9264bc5b4d9dc which is the
stable/liberty backport that fixes bug 1499620.

The changes since 1.11.0 are:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/oslo.log$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.11.0..
e9aa188 Updated from global requirements
83dd605 Fix unintended assignment of "syslog"
f2f10a1 Updated from global requirements
0337395 Update .gitreview for stable/liberty

The two requirements updates should be OK to put out in a patch version
release of oslo.log since:

1. e9aa188 is excluding oslo.utils 2.6.0

2. f2f10a1 requires pbr>=1.6 which is the minimum version required for
   pbr in g-r stable/liberty.

Related-Bug: #1499620

Change-Id: I67ca9500eff5d902b13cd18eebcd7539ec8bbc44
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
liberty: release oslo.log 1.11.1

This is to release 83dd60562fa79d31337e9b9ecec9264bc5b4d9dc which is the
stable/liberty backport that fixes bug 1499620.

The changes since 1.11.0 are:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/oslo.log$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.11.0..
e9aa188 Updated from global requirements
83dd605 Fix unintended assignment of "syslog"
f2f10a1 Updated from global requirements
0337395 Update .gitreview for stable/liberty

The two requirements updates should be OK to put out in a patch version
release of oslo.log since:

1. e9aa188 is excluding oslo.utils 2.6.0

2. f2f10a1 requires pbr>=1.6 which is the minimum version required for
   pbr in g-r stable/liberty.

Related-Bug: #1499620

Change-Id: I67ca9500eff5d902b13cd18eebcd7539ec8bbc44

commit_message:
Refine event_log_formatter output

- Fix timestamp printing so that date is first, and time doesn't have
  truncated seconds
- Remove event UUID from output since it is of limited usefulness and
  causes clutter

Change-Id: I646be059546289b4131956ba050ec1f1f74ab3b9
Closes-Bug: #1516481

commit_message:
make the driver.Scheduler as abstract class

method select_destinations is the abstract method, every subclass
of Scheduler should override, so add abstractmethod decorator

Change-Id: Ib9edd7ac9fc024543efb0b878431fa8351c68a45

commit_message:
UI:Actions list:remove desc column+details screen

* Removed “Description” column.
* Added “Action details” overview screen
  which shows a detailed view of specific action.

Screen: http://pasteboard.co/2aNN6XAH.png

Partially implements blueprint: Actions-screen-improvements
Closes-Bug: 1505659
Change-Id: Ie0298d9856f88a5ecca0ea0497bc9c1b9ba83c9f

commit_message:
Sync code from oslo incubator and fix imports

Sync common code from oslo incubator to make our stable/kilo branch be
compatible with dependencies for project.

Cherry-pick following commits from "stable/kilo" branch of oslo-incubator:
Idb68321, Ifab8a09, I408e14d, Ic0d4053, 0cc741a, 66bad01

Fix imports of oslo.utils and oslo.serialization.

Closes-Bug: #1480221

Change-Id: Ica2268649a855f2f1c6d6c7ceb21297d12094364

commit_message:
Make functional object tests actually run

Object tests were being skipped over because we were checking for the
wrong service name. Also fixes list_containers() method.

commit_message:
cells is a sad panda about scheduler hints

The new test_schedule_to_all_nodes test fails in some epic ways in
cells. Not really worth debugging, this is a new test and had just
exposed another cells / devstack issue. Just skip the test.

Change-Id: Icc71e36f4ecb015dff9e806caacd31262f7e17f7

commit_message:
Extend utils/build module

Add options:
* Automatically disable puppetd to be auto-started on boot,
  in case puppet is installed
* Add functions to pass host-resolving configs(resolv.conf,hosts)

Change-Id: I60a0a17e0d1ab546e7ee16a618699fec193387d4

subject: Add oslo_config program support to paste middleware
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 23:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/base.py', 'doc/source/cors.rst', 'doc/source/oslo_config.rst'], 'message': "Add oslo_config program support to paste middleware

oslo_config's configfile autodiscovery permits an additional parameter
named 'prog', which will add an additional file name to the possible
files that are checked in oslo_config directories. This patch adds this
parameter to paste-ini initialization, permitting access to more
configuration files.

This feature is required by glance, as glance does not make use of
./glance/glance.conf. Instead, they use ./glance/glance-api.conf. The
appropriate middleware configuration in this case would then be:

oslo_config_project=glance
oslog_config_program=glance-api

Change-Id: Ie530e4fac8076dc46b705770d12940ef91cb4644
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add oslo_config program support to paste middleware

oslo_config's configfile autodiscovery permits an additional parameter
named 'prog', which will add an additional file name to the possible
files that are checked in oslo_config directories. This patch adds this
parameter to paste-ini initialization, permitting access to more
configuration files.

This feature is required by glance, as glance does not make use of
./glance/glance.conf. Instead, they use ./glance/glance-api.conf. The
appropriate middleware configuration in this case would then be:

oslo_config_project=glance
oslog_config_program=glance-api

Change-Id: Ie530e4fac8076dc46b705770d12940ef91cb4644

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 16:40:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Skip offline nodes

Apparently, shotgun never tested which nodes are online
prior to execute snapshot method of objects. Therefore, for offline
nodes shotgun will then consume a lot of time waiting for connection
timeouts to be happened on per object basis.

This patch:
* adds nodes check to `config.py` in order to detect offline
  nodes prior of doing snapshot of objects related to them.
* adds `Offline` object driver. Being snapshotted, this object just
  creates a file with friendly reminder that particular node was
  offline inside of snapshot target directory. So, one which's
  looking at snapshot archive will effectively realize that node
  was offline without deep diving into shotgun log file.
* changes `objects` generator. For offline nodes it yeilds
  `Offline` object.

So, shotgun won't waste time or per object basis, as it was before.

Change-Id: Ib99476c7b67a04d4f472f3fa3803b3fb92d4fec4
Closes-Bug: #1397038
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-05 18:21:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Skip offline nodes

Apparently, shotgun never tested which nodes are online
prior to execute snapshot method of objects. Therefore, for offline
nodes shotgun will then consume a lot of time waiting for connection
timeouts to be happened on per object basis.

This patch totally rework how shotgun hanldes the objects:
* objects being processed on per host basis
* on NetworkError, all remaining objects on per host basis will be
  postponed for processing at the end of queue.
* if postponed objects still couldn't be proccessed, they will then
  be converted into offline objects.
* adds `Offline` object driver. Being snapshotted, this object just
  creates a file with friendly reminder that particular node was
  offline inside of snapshot target directory. So, one which's
  looking at snapshot archive will effectively realize that node
  was offline without deep diving into shotgun log file.

So, shotgun won't waste time or per object basis, as it was before.

Change-Id: Ib99476c7b67a04d4f472f3fa3803b3fb92d4fec4
Closes-Bug: #1397038

commit_message:
Skip offline nodes

Apparently, shotgun never tested which nodes are online
prior to execute snapshot method of objects. Therefore, for offline
nodes shotgun will then consume a lot of time waiting for connection
timeouts to be happened on per object basis.

This patch totally rework how shotgun handles the objects:
* objects being processed on per host basis
* on NetworkError, all affected objects on per host basis will be
  postponed for processing at the end of queue.
* if postponed objects still couldn't be proccessed on the last
  attempt, they will then be converted into offline objects.
* adds `Offline` object driver. Being snapshotted, this object just
  creates a file with friendly reminder that particular node was
  offline inside of snapshot target directory. So, one which's
  looking at snapshot archive will effectively realize that node
  was offline without deep diving into shotgun log file.

So, shotgun won't waste time or per object basis, as it was before.

Change-Id: Ib99476c7b67a04d4f472f3fa3803b3fb92d4fec4
Closes-Bug: #1397038

commit_message:
Explicitly disable vCenter certificate verification check

- nova-compute with enabled VCDriver by default tries to verify vCenter
  certificate, if it cannot verify certificate then it cannot start and
  operate normally.  This breaks deployment process for OpenStack
  clusters that use vCenter, because later in post deployment stage we
  cannot add nova-compute services to availability zone, because they
  failed to start.

Change-Id: Iac725db304aae9cd9da910f16d16d4054cc10542
Closes-bug: #1513832
DocImpact: Document the fact that currently it is not possible to
verify vCenter SSL certificate by providing CA certificate bundle.

commit_message:

According to our guidelines, INFO level messages should be important
state changes, which are of interest for an operator.
