subject: Make sure Facter is only executed on agent
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-10 22:17:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Swamp out Facter[].value with Facter.value()

  This commit swaps out the usage of Facter['osfamily'].value with
  Facter.value(:osfamily) in all glance types that are affected.

  This is being done to fix an issue with the [] method on the Facter
  module in Puppet 4.2.3 and Facter 3.1.1.

Change-Id: I773f20e0bc1e917f6ec5fa8830f5bbfa60b6cd8a
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-12 22:59:39.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/glance_registry_paste_ini.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_api_paste_ini.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_cache_config.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_registry_config.rb', 'lib/puppet/type/glance_api_config.rb'], 'message': 'Make sure Facter is only executed on agent

  This commit moves conditionals based on values obtained from Facter
  inside code blocks that are only executed on agents and replaces
  the use of Facter['osfamily'].value with Facter.value:(:osfamily).

  Without this change we are returning values based off the master's
  facts, so if a Debian agent checks into a RedHat master then the type
  is currently making a decision based off of RedHat and not the actual
  OS of the agent running the catalog.  Code ran outside blocks is
  evaluated on masters and inside a block is evaluated by the agent when
  the catalog is executed.  We do not notice this because all our
  testing uses "puppet apply" and autorequire only matters when they
  find a matching resource name in the catalog.  The latter results
  in no error because the relationship is simply ignored on the Debian
  agent if a package resource with the RedHat name is not found.

  This issue was found by running facter 3, the C++11 re-implementation
  under the jruby and clojure implemented puppetserver.  The clojure
  jni shim written so that facter can be ran inside of puppetserver does
  not implement the [] method for the Facter module but the ruby shim
  does.  So I noticed that the code had an issue when
  Facter['osfamily'].value was executed on the master, which returned a
  not method error.  Once again, something we didn't notice becuase we
  do not test against a master.  I decided to migrate to
  Facter.value(:osfamily) to simply keep to an API that is consistent
  across both puppet and puppetserver but fixing where the code runs
  does actually solve the not method found error.

Change-Id: I773f20e0bc1e917f6ec5fa8830f5bbfa60b6cd8a
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Make sure Facter is only executed on agent

  This commit moves conditionals based on values obtained from Facter
  inside code blocks that are only executed on agents and replaces
  the use of Facter['osfamily'].value with Facter.value:(:osfamily).

  Without this change we are returning values based off the master's
  facts, so if a Debian agent checks into a RedHat master then the type
  is currently making a decision based off of RedHat and not the actual
  OS of the agent running the catalog.  Code ran outside blocks is
  evaluated on masters and inside a block is evaluated by the agent when
  the catalog is executed.  We do not notice this because all our
  testing uses "puppet apply" and autorequire only matters when they
  find a matching resource name in the catalog.  The latter results
  in no error because the relationship is simply ignored on the Debian
  agent if a package resource with the RedHat name is not found.

  This issue was found by running facter 3, the C++11 re-implementation
  under the jruby and clojure implemented puppetserver.  The clojure
  jni shim written so that facter can be ran inside of puppetserver does
  not implement the [] method for the Facter module but the ruby shim
  does.  So I noticed that the code had an issue when
  Facter['osfamily'].value was executed on the master, which returned a
  not method error.  Once again, something we didn't notice becuase we
  do not test against a master.  I decided to migrate to
  Facter.value(:osfamily) to simply keep to an API that is consistent
  across both puppet and puppetserver but fixing where the code runs
  does actually solve the not method found error.

Change-Id: I773f20e0bc1e917f6ec5fa8830f5bbfa60b6cd8a

commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing tokens expiration issue when deleting Tempest resources

The current cleanup mechanism for deleting Tempest resources after
the tests finished doesn't work properly. If Tempest tests take more
than 1 hour, we will not be able to delete a resource because of token
expiration. So this mechanism was slightly reworked to fix the issue.

Change-Id: I9807109e6cf7e5652c5fe73c433b7a9a8f3f489d

Crochet', 'email': 'brad@redhat.com', 'username': 'bcrochet'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11997, 'name': 'Lennart Regebro', 'email': 'lregebro@redhat.com', 'username': 'lregebro'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-19 17:14:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Don't log exceptions redundantly

The pattern

self.log.error('Some message')
self.log.exception(e)

is redundant and misuses the logging.exception function.  The
argument to exception() is supposed to be a string describing the
error that occurred, not the exception itself.  It already pulls
the exception details from the exception handler context and
includes them in the output.

This changes the instances of the above pattern to simply

self.log.exception('Some message')

which results in the correct output of something like:

ERROR:root:Some message
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./test.py", line 23, in <module>
    raise Exception('foo')
Exception: foo

Change-Id: Ia55ec34256ceb6f095c2fbfe2d085567f6382509
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-20 21:43:34.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Don't log exceptions redundantly

The pattern

self.log.exception(e)

is redundant and misuses the logging.exception function.  The
argument to exception() is supposed to be a string describing the
error that occurred, not the exception itself.  It already pulls
the exception details from the exception handler context and
includes them in the output.

This changes the instances of the above pattern to simply

self.log.exception('Some message')

which results in the correct output of something like:

ERROR:root:Some message
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./test.py", line 23, in <module>
    raise Exception('foo')
Exception: foo

Change-Id: Ia55ec34256ceb6f095c2fbfe2d085567f6382509
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Don't log exceptions redundantly

The pattern

self.log.error('Some message')
self.log.exception(e)

is redundant and misuses the logging.exception function.  The
argument to exception() is supposed to be a string describing the
error that occurred, not the exception itself.  It already pulls
the exception details from the exception handler context and
includes them in the output.

This changes the instances of the above pattern to simply

self.log.exception('Some message')

which results in the correct output of something like:

ERROR:root:Some message
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./test.py", line 23, in <module>
    raise Exception('foo')
Exception: foo

Change-Id: Ia55ec34256ceb6f095c2fbfe2d085567f6382509

[{'created': '2015-11-14 05:28:30.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/cfg.py'], 'message': "Don't convert ValueError into NoSuchOptError in ConfigOpts

In method __getattr__ of ConfigOpts, we catch all exceptions and convert
it to NoSuchOptError. This is wrong, we need allow raise ValueError to
provide more details about the error.
(cherry picked from commit 2576dd3eb139fe500567c8022429744903726a21)

Closes-Bug: #1507516
Change-Id: Ic08b812424ff9ad79f03a9069877b610fcbd4172
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't convert ValueError into NoSuchOptError in ConfigOpts

In method __getattr__ of ConfigOpts, we catch all exceptions and convert
it to NoSuchOptError. This is wrong, we need allow raise ValueError to
provide more details about the error.
(cherry picked from commit 2576dd3eb139fe500567c8022429744903726a21)

Closes-Bug: #1507516
Change-Id: Ic08b812424ff9ad79f03a9069877b610fcbd4172

[{'created': '2015-08-29 00:52:15.000000000', 'files': ['environments/network-isolation-no-tunneling.yaml'], 'message': 'Add environment for isolated networks without tunneling VLAN

This change introduces an environment file that includes isolated
networks but does not include a Tenant tunneling network. This is
for deployments where the tenant networking will be provided by
tenant VLANs, or provider networks, or another non-tunneling method.

Change-Id: I8a05e341de80c2add418f22fa7f6f06349d378d6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add environment for isolated networks without tunneling VLAN

This change introduces an environment file that includes isolated
networks but does not include a Tenant tunneling network. This is
for deployments where the tenant networking will be provided by
tenant VLANs, or provider networks, or another non-tunneling method.

Change-Id: I8a05e341de80c2add418f22fa7f6f06349d378d6

commit_message:
Support network isolation without external nets

This patch adds extra heat environments that can be used
to enable network isolation without using the external
network. Instead of a separate external network the ctlplane
will be used for all of the external/public traffic.

Change-Id: Ia542cee02121771d7d57ac701b62d7608e8d1855

commit_message:
Add the GlanceRegistry and Horizon endpoints to EndpointMap

We need to pass details of the Glance Registry and public Horizon
endpoints to the load balancers so add them to the EndpointMap

Change-Id: Ia6261223e7701734f47ce48471c86f690ba3dcd5

commit_message:
Make CloudName available for Endpoints

CloudName is the DNS name for the public VIP this means we will likely
want it available for use in the endpoint hostnames, rather than people
needing to copy and paste the same hostname

Change-Id: Ic6d708b083244442195eee890de91bbc7e133ec2

commit_message:
Add serializer for delete_all_keys task

This task will delete all ssh keys and ssl certs for cluster when it's
reset, but first it needs a serializer.

Change-Id: I19e253b1ab21da1b556b36cf7d7bfb0b9205581a
Partial-bug: #1507361

commit_message:
Task for deleting ssh keys and ssl certs generated for deployment

This task will be called during cluster reset to make sure that there
will be new keys generated during next deployment of this env.

validating tasklib checks the graph to be connected, unless the task has
'detached' set to true, in which case it's not checked as part of
deployment graph.

Change-Id: I78203d0922316f02f08955f109c760aa45f8cd8d
Partial-bug: #1507361
Depends-On: I19e253b1ab21da1b556b36cf7d7bfb0b9205581a

commit_message:
libvirt: rework membacking config to support future features

This commit reworks the method responsable to return
the guest configuration for the backend memory to make
it able to support other cases than hugepages

Change-Id: Ib32395d69ed3b8d0f6f1c0e7a3f6d31ed561d037

commit_message:
Rename semantic-version dep to semantic_version

The package is actually named semantic_version, not semantic-version. This is
known to cause errors in old pip versions and with non standard setups,
so lets name it correctly.

Change-Id: I119d47afc8106cfe9a15e939cd1d425e8a1b2746

commit_message:
Revert "Lodgeit: Enable check/gate for python 2.7"

The changes to make the tests work were not merged yet, so now
Jenkins is scoring -2 on lodgeit changes.

I'll submit this again after the necessary changes are merged.

This reverts commit 0f4a4d6114fe0896d2b0be6383f62faeb5c27fa8.

Change-Id: I19a1f3708d100356620201487f9490daca41d71d

place them instead outside of the build directory.

[{'created': '2015-03-19 09:37:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMware: expand support for Opaque networks

commit_message:
VMware: expand support for Opaque networks

The original support for Opaque networks make use of a
configuration flag indicating that a global integration bridge
was configured on the ESX host. If this global integration
bridge was used then that would be selected as the opaque network.

The next generation NSX neutron plugin will not make use of the
integration bridge. This will require that we make use of the network
ID for the opaque network.

The support for VC 6.0 has specific support for this. For 5.5 we make
use of a DynamicProperty setting to achieve the same goal.

DocImpact

For backward compatible opaque support the setting
'CONF.vmware.integration_bridge' needs to be set.
If this is not set then the network id will be used as the
opaque id.

In addition to this the default value has been set to 'None'.

Implements blueprint vmware-expand-opaque-support

Change-Id: I309ca2bc8186b8eefc0a979d039dd4cd2a6f89f6

commit_message:
Update startdash/startpanel for newer Django patterns

Django has transitioned to argparse for management commands, and this
patch migrates Horizon's commands to use the newer patterns.

Change-Id: Ib62286a92dd026d2e1224193a93f00846aa07fff
Closes-bug: #1496164

commit_message:
Add 'blocked' status to TestRail test results

Mark result as blocked if test was skipped due to
failure of another dependent test.

Change-Id: I05713ead653b2dc4bb1a4021cef6404abc079036
Closes-bug: #1515529

Remove unused common exception.

Some exceptions are not in used in any where.
If there are no support issues,
I think we should directly remove them.

commit_message:
Rework service broker authorization process

Now we can use keystonemiddleware and murano context middleware for requests
from outside OpenStack so we don't need to recreate keystoneclient for each
request and can easily get token from the request headers. That makes
authorization proccess a lot easier in terms of source code.

Change-Id: If937501074b85d43921fdb108f8af3babeded828
Closes-Bug: #1512254

commit_message:
Split os upgrade tests into two classes

- Split os upgrade tests into 2 separate
classes: one to prepare env for upgrade and
one to do upgrade itself

Closes-Bug: #1515629
(cherry picked from commit 3b120bec3d0505153f862dd36d7d2704ed99083a)

commit_message:
Add retries to TestRail client

In order to workaround API limitations (such as
requests rate), adding mechanism of requests
retries based on predefined error codes.

Try to resend request 3 times if '429' code is
received from API.

Closes-bug: #1514797
Change-Id: I723ef7886c86b7e418627962a1ff8aa7a4281c0a
(cherry picked from commit 0debb2816160b27660449cf16561191e75539d82)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7173, 'name': 'Scott DAngelo', 'email': 'scott.dangelo@gmail.com', 'username': 'scottda'}, {'_account_id': 9171, 'name': 'Vipin Balachandran', 'email': 'vipin.bl@gmail.com', 'username': 'vbala'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12249, 'name': 'Scality CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@scality.com', 'username': 'scality-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15296, 'name': 'Brocade Openstack CI', 'email': 'Brocade-Openstack-CI@Brocade.com', 'username': 'Brocade-Openstack-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-16 11:08:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/service.py'], 'message': 'sqlalchemy exception kills FixedIntervalLoopingCall thread

Transient DB errors should not kill the thread for FixedIntervalLoopingCall.
This was noticed and fixed for the DBError case in Bug#1466991, but the
exception from sqlalchemy is not handled. Basically, self.model_disconnected
should be set to True, but the looping thread should carry on regardless of
the error.

Change-Id: I4bf04392269a2c33b77166b6c7408b38e1bc992d
Closes-Bug: #1478971
(cherry picked from commit c0f6a6e9e9b8713d12a02b8441c7616c24871526)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy exception kills FixedIntervalLoopingCall thread

Transient DB errors should not kill the thread for FixedIntervalLoopingCall.
This was noticed and fixed for the DBError case in Bug#1466991, but the
exception from sqlalchemy is not handled. Basically, self.model_disconnected
should be set to True, but the looping thread should carry on regardless of
the error.

Change-Id: I4bf04392269a2c33b77166b6c7408b38e1bc992d
Closes-Bug: #1478971
(cherry picked from commit c0f6a6e9e9b8713d12a02b8441c7616c24871526)

commit_message:
Support overriding of driver classpath in Spark jobs

It might be useful to have ability to override default value for cluster
of driver-class-path option for the particular job execution. The change
add new config option: "edp.spark.driver.classpath" that
can override driver-class-path for users' needs.

Implements blueprint: spark-override-classpath
Change-Id: I94055c2ccb70c953620b62ed18c27895c3588327

commit_message:
Report stack_status_reason on heat failure

When stack create fails, report the status reason, instead
of just the status. This gives the user useful information about
the cause of the failure (out of floating IPs, etc.) instead of
just "CREATE_FAILED".

Change-Id: Ibbaf14e8959cecfade98d13f8101e333eb76ee6e
Closes-Bug: 1516016

commit_message:
Make osprofiler>=0.3.1 required

This version of osprofiler allows us to avoid keeping arguments
in api-paste.ini files, which was required by some of OpenStack
projects.

Change-Id: I8e28968293b598958e06ed3cd7d2a8fb707ebf8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 08:04:56.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/lib/facter/acpid_version.rb', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/host.pp'], 'message': 'Check the acpid version before starting the service

acpid 1.x used the deprecated /proc/acpi/event interface to listen for
ACPI events. In newer kernel releases that interface has been removed
and acpid made to use netlink instead, making the check always evaluate
to false on CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I7fb44c901fcaa9006e00c8bd77a2cca32219b4ed
Closes-bug: 1514817
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Check the acpid version before starting the service

acpid 1.x used the deprecated /proc/acpi/event interface to listen for
ACPI events. In newer kernel releases that interface has been removed
and acpid made to use netlink instead, making the check always evaluate
to false on CentOS 7.

Change-Id: I7fb44c901fcaa9006e00c8bd77a2cca32219b4ed
Closes-bug: 1514817

commit_message:
Add hacking rule for "GET /resources"

This patch is a prototype for "GET /resources" hacking rule.
black_list_T110.txt file contains the service client files which
are against this rule. So we need to fix them with removing them
from this file.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I150fe2ef21d4d4d246a46d9baf2fb14cc7d79ee5

commit_message:
Remove BaseComputeTest and _api_version

On the history Nova had two major API versions V2 and V3, and Tempest
contained the tests for both APIs with inheritances of test classes.
Then some classes contain _api_version and there are some base test
classes.
However V3 has been removed and now these base test classes and the
_api_version are meaningless. So it is nice to remove for cleanup.

Change-Id: Icefb304a94492d92905cc425c442f10ebfe7d8b3

commit_message:
Remove the unnecessary log message

This change removed the unnecessary log messages.
Those messages are duplicated with messages in exception functions.

Co-Authored-By: Rico Lin <rico.l@inwinstack.com>

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-09-04 17:36:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Image-list backwards compatibility for v2

This makes parts of image-list backwards compatable with v1. This is
because we do not want to break peoples stuff. So the default mode
(no api specified) will just silently accept these values.

This patch follows those guidelines, it will not show help for a
deprecated command and print to std error and if the api version is
specified this won't work.

I am following this:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-backwards-compatibility for how
this should work.

This adds backwards compatibility for:
--name
--status
--container-format
--disk-format
--is-public

Change-Id: Ib2b164d94ea6a1a14c5a123bc66ba8356e96de2d

commit_message:
Image backwards compatibility for v2

This makes parts of image-list, image-create and image-update backwards
compatable with v1. This is because we do not want to break peoples
stuff. So the default mode (no api specified) will just silently accept
these values.

This patch follows those guidelines, it will not show help for a
deprecated command and print to std error and if the api version is
specified this won't work.

I am following this:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/glance-backwards-compatibility for how
this should work.

This adds backwards compatibility for:
Image-List
--name
--status
--container-format
--disk-format
--is-public

Image-Create
--is-public
--is-protected

Image-update
--is-public
--is-protected
--human-readable

Change-Id: Ib2b164d94ea6a1a14c5a123bc66ba8356e96de2d

commit_message:
Fixed broken assignment to dictionary using integer key

The case

$dict[$key]: value

for integer $key was not addressed in LHS expression logic.
As a result no changes were made to $dict and no error was raised.

Change-Id: I969dab5f0d32312cf52490945934557c32f22dde
Closes-Bug: #1515612

commit_message:
Use a single command to create the 3 watcher endpoints.

--internalurl, --publicurl and --adminurl options are now
mandatory for creation of service endpoints into Keystone, by
using openstack CLI.

Change-Id: Ic5da04e20931de77e747a8bace8833a1850d9dae
Closes-Bug: #1515413

commit_message:
Move dhcp_lease_duration into DHCP agent config options list

It is DHCP agent specific, and so it should not be present in
neutron.conf or be reported as a valid option for other services.

Also modified the help message slightly to avoid mentioning dnsmasq
since the option could in theory be used by alternative dhcp drivers.

Change-Id: I66bcea1c3a6ce6fa9ce56ea8137a94858f18dc5a

commit_message:
Fix issue with system installed xtrabackup

The change adds a task to ensure that the system provided
xtrabackup package is removed before installing the downloaded
version using the deb. This is required to ensure that there
are no version conflicts when installing the package.

The change also corrects the version of the galera server repo
in the defaults directory. While the repo correct version of
mariadb is being installed the name of the assumed repo is wrong.

Closes-Bug: #1513459

Change-Id: I63cb546cf5a4386320f01ed6f2120dd7c8341335
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add IPA-based job for ironic-inspector

IPA (ironic-python-agent) is a new default ramdisk for ironic,
replacing old bash-based ramdisks in diskimage-builder.

This change adds a new job to ironic-inspector using IPA for both
deploy and inspection. Old job now has -dib postfix to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I0108f432872d84a40203153a592e11a697da1e68

commit_message:
Use skip_checks for live-migration feature in test

flag compute_feature_enabled.live_migration is class-wide,
so it make sense to use skip_checks method for class, instead
of decorating each test with skipIf, skipUnless, etc.

Change-Id: I62006b7e636b1773f4f41709cfec1fd6daae3c4f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-11 21:31:40.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': "Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add missing constraints in yum_update.sh

Some missing pacemaker constraints were added in the following commits:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219770/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219665/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218931/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218930/

Overclouds that were deployed prior to these constraints being added to
tripleo-heat-templates still have the constraints missing. During an
update, stopping and starting the cluster can fail without these
constraints in place.  As a workaround, conditionally add these
contraints in yum_update.sh so that we're sure they're always present
before updating.

Change-Id: Id46c85dbbe5e85d362279661091b17ce1b697fe0

subject: Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 14:16:01.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/yum_update.sh'], 'message': "Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates

This matches change I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba, but we
need it to set it before attempting the cluster stop - yum update -
cluster start cycle, to make sure this cycle doesn't hit the low timeout
limits.

This can be removed once updates from deployments made prior to
I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba are no longer supported.

Change-Id: I587136d8d045d213875c657ea5a405074f80c8ad
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Set start/stop pacemaker resource timeouts for updates

This matches change I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba, but we
need it to set it before attempting the cluster stop - yum update -
cluster start cycle, to make sure this cycle doesn't hit the low timeout
limits.

This can be removed once updates from deployments made prior to
I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba are no longer supported.

Change-Id: I587136d8d045d213875c657ea5a405074f80c8ad

commit_message:
Bump further the stop/start timeout for pcmk/systemd services

This bumps further up the stop/start timeout for the pcmk/systemd
services so that it matches the 100s default set in future pcmk
versions [1].

1. https://github.com/ClusterLabs/pacemaker/commit/17d65e9f44061a4fa14a9cddd6edc403b2d6d2b3

Change-Id: I6fc18f1ad876c5a25723710a3b20d8ec9519dcba

commit_message:
Remove python 2.6 and cleanup tox.ini

* Remove support for python 2.6
* Remove skipsdist : Needs to be set only if 
  sdist is expensive
* Remove usedevelop : only needed when skipsdist 
  is set to True
* Remove install_command : We can just use the 
  default, we don't need to override


Change-Id: If054a295dc58636bd317491e0f6cd454d1821a3e

commit_message:
Fix docker.io bug in the Install Guide

Currently the Install Guide section regarding CoreOS images
and how to build them names the "docker" service "docker.io",
which is wrong. This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: Ie5837cae013d0c5595c9ba992a60bcd3ca1bc0e0
Closes-Bug: #1515283

commit_message:
Add mistral-specs

After discussion with Mistral core team, we decided to adopt the
specification approval process, like other official projects. Please see
the dependent patch in governance repo.

Change-Id: I6e273a854d35bf8179a4306800de78d574ae2da4
Depends-on: I7da1ffaee454383704beb94b0c2bc9786dd1846f

commit_message:
Limit project-config-gerrit

In only 10 % of commits a file in gerrit/acls/ is changed, so limit
project-config-gerrit to run only if one of the files gets changed
that it tests or uses.

Change-Id: I16101a47c2720d8b734db1cabec9069c0838d4cd

commit_message:
Enhance validation of custom repositories settings data

Separate method for validation custom repo settings added to
AttributesVAlidator class. Now validation checks repos in flat format.

Change-Id: I66c4916383d464502e958ea97480a64c2659bec6
Closes-Bug: #1458619

commit_message:
Limit run on gate-project-config-jenkins-project

Run this job only if one of the files that this uses changes.

Out of the last 200 commits, only 66 changed
jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml, so this limit only runs the test
in 33 % of submissions.

Change-Id: I4437096da0cf2cab478b5796c8c62a0178fef3ae

commit_message:
Publish draft releasenotes

Upload the generated draft releasenotes so that they can be easily
reviewed - similar to documents with just clicking on the gate.

Rename the job to gate-{name}-releasenotes, the tox is not needed
anymore in the name.

Change-Id: Ib542084a275a5bfe82c48517d48372fec6411e16

commit_message:
Remove verbose code for hive metastore schema creation in MapR plugin

Use a property datanucleus.autoCreateSchema which creates schema on
startup if one does not exist.

Change-Id: I08421aae16cbddd810557734b680d986018b9139
Implements: blueprint hive-metastore-setup

commit_message:
Run py34 first in default tox run

this avoids py34 failure in default tox run when testrepository is
not yet initialized (e.g. fresh repo clone).

Change-Id: I7aa1817cfac3a60e6faabd1b21be736857b4c103
Closes-Bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Adding autogenerated saharaclient API docs

Saharaclient API docs now can be autogenerated, that
prevents them from manual update. Also docstrings
were added to describe some unclear parameters.

Change-Id: Ibf9fdf332c91cdfb18d6f8ec5429a39dc2862494

commit_message:
Add stable/liberty tripleo job

Recently tripleo created stable/liberty branches for several repos, ref
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/221811/, this adds an initial job
which will test using these new branches.

Co-Authored-By: Derek Higgins <derekh@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I34ea635382114bf4f075f3d8df1188c3beae8727
Depends-On: I1c7a696cf45f9b7d02d8f603fe3377769b1c5672
Change-Id: I5334525e16a8ff59aff48c8f8125ef27965aaba3

commit_message:
tempest-dsvm-multinode-live-migration: use d-g for tempest

Use devstack-gate scripts to configure tempest.
Then hook in nova will only run initial tempest test
and make configuration changes then

commit_message:
Enabled lightweight jobs for stable branches of fuel-repos

To unblock merge to stable branches this commit:
* enable pep8 jobs for python repos
* enable puppet-lint job for puppet repo

Change-Id: I5fb79e7d6d643b2b09a50fa23c28833f7992db03

commit_message:
Rename get_job_status to get_job_info in oozie.py

get_job_status actually get job's info in oozie.py, rename it to
get_job_info to avoid the confusion.

Change-Id: I0628bcd0760b45e8345027f4dbd1e6c5d7c6e9fd
Closes-bug: 1515706

commit_message:
ES6size app.js

app.js now mostly uses ES6 syntax. This commit also moves
initialization of the app to a separate method and removes
a hack for ajax callbacks - we don't need it anymore.

Change-Id: Iba48469d195601e6bf450f1d33ba1db4a9a666bc

commit_message:
Pick up Lock Breaker from TODO items

Work items:
- Add a function to check engine status,
  and a timeout option in config.
- Add steal operation for lock_acquire.

Reference:
[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/senlin/+spec/lock-breaker
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/senlin/+bug/1514742

Change-Id: I1dbb3068496465a9c84810a819a9bdac43f9272b

commit_message:
Sql database in installation guide with wrong python package name

The package python2-PyMySQL doesn't exist:

No matches found
2015-11-08 22:09:47 yum search python2-PyMySQL

commit_message:
DRAFT Sync UI and Templated Networking

Ironic integration requires adding an optional network role and network.

Let's discuss how can this be achieved in the current state of the art
in Fuel and its Templated Networking feature.

Specifies blueprint sync-ui-and-templated-networking

Change-Id: Id84a6215652d9f83838861bb7bfb38a1dcdfc482

commit_message:
Move the content of CONTRIBUTING.rst to doc/source

When using cross reference across docs, it is easy to
handle them if the document itself in doc/source.
Otherwise, if we see CONTRIBUTING.rst in the top directory
directly, we cannot follow sphinx references.

Change-Id: I96b6cd24dcbf16e3923e4bc6fe4069d692e75993

commit_message:
This commit is for testing purpose. To confirm
microversion related changes with one of reviewer.
Please ignore it.

Change-Id: Icf1e463c2e3ebb50c38199bc5c690af715a2147e

Attr "is_public" can not be set for share using API "manage"

This fix allows manila-manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: Ia19a1373013ef699e2b953aa2c61d4ac2b89d41d
Closes-Bug: #1436865

commit_message:
Attr "is_public" can not be set for share using API "manage"

This fix allows manila-manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: I747e5fae6119d8cb619e9be8d832cb4a22b6a192
Closes-Bug: #1436865

commit_message:
Attr "is_public" can not be set for share using API "manage"

This fix allows manila-manage command to explicitly
set visibility (key '--public') similar to using API
"create".

Change-Id: I39705acbfca844b66d74fbd2fee228a7a85bc2d9
Closes-Bug: #1436865

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-27 05:06:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS from v2.1 API

We defined API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS as core Nova APIs.
If these core APIs are not loaded, the boot of nova-api failed.
However, now defcore team is trying to define core APIs and it is
not necessary to define them in Nova itself. In addition, we will
remove API extensions in long term. So now API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS
becomes meaningless.
This patch removes API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS for avoiding confusions
related to the API extensions.

Change-Id: I84ab02801c19aa3bf9509ff748f40716566ee9ff
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-27 06:56:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/__init__.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_sample_base.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_extensions.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_v3_extensions.py'], 'message': 'Remove API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS from v2.1 API

commit_message:
Remove API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS from v2.1 API

We defined API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS as core Nova APIs.
If these core APIs are not loaded, the boot of nova-api failed.
However, now defcore team is trying to define core APIs and it is
not necessary to define them in Nova itself. In addition, we will
remove API extensions in long term. So now API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS
becomes meaningless.
This patch removes API_V3_CORE_EXTENSIONS for avoiding confusions
related to the API extensions.

Change-Id: I84ab02801c19aa3bf9509ff748f40716566ee9ff

commit_message:
Use stevedore entry point instead of module path for interface driver

This is a preparation to move the interface driver from neutron
to our repository.

Related-Bug: #1510826
Change-Id: I3d9c7eeef8a34f75d8fcf40ac187a9d4da92f807
(cherry picked from commit ecfbd45f6c893697e6f35a402920250d2c5c7c23)

subject: Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 18:28:04.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors

By default, devstack creates it's own test flavors for Tempest runs.

These are not in the cells API database since they are non-default
for nova so any resize tests in Tempest with cells and these custom
flavors fail.

Configure Tempest to not run resize tests if using cells and custom
flavors.

This allows us to also clean up a bunch of the resize skips found
in nova/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc.

Change-Id: I20f46024e45e32c60275703a193a56ae8cfe7eca
Closes-Bug: #1513925
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors

By default, devstack creates it's own test flavors for Tempest runs.

These are not in the cells API database since they are non-default
for nova so any resize tests in Tempest with cells and these custom
flavors fail.

Configure Tempest to not run resize tests if using cells and custom
flavors.

This allows us to also clean up a bunch of the resize skips found
in nova/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc.

Change-Id: I20f46024e45e32c60275703a193a56ae8cfe7eca
Closes-Bug: #1513925

commit_message:
swift flags: read from RST

The extract_swift_flags.py script parses the existing docbook tables to
discover documented options. We're now switching to RST so implement
reading from RST tables, and make it the default behaviour.

Implements: blueprint config-ref-rst
Change-Id: Ib7a14cc52337fc1abd8b02a8ff33396c0b992746

commit_message:
[install] Fix various minor problems

Fix the following minor problems to reduce work after
stable/liberty branching:

1) RDO: Revert Python MySQL library from PyMySQL to MySQL-python
   due to lack of support for the former.
2) RDO: Explicitly install 'ebtables' and 'ipset' packages due
   to dependency problems.
3) General: Change numbered list to bulleted list for lists with
   only one item.
4) General: Restructure horizon content to match other services.
   More duplication of content, but sometimes RST conditionals
   are terrible and distro packages should use the same
   configuration files.
5) General: Restructure NoSQL content to match SQL content.
6) General: Improve clarity of NTP content.

Change-Id: I2620250aa27c7d41b525aa2646ad25e0692140c4
Closes-Bug: #1514760
Closes-Bug: #1514683
Implements: bp installguide-liberty

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-30 14:03:39.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'Remove multi-region workaround

When keystone API v3 was introduced, filtering regions when listing
endpoints was not supported (see [1]). This caused multi-region devstack
deployments to fail (see [2]). A workaround was introduced to devstack
to enable for multi-region deployments until region filtering would work
in keystone API v3.
Now that the bug related to region filtering in keystone is resolved,
the workaround should be removed.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1482772
[2]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1483784

Closes-Bug: #1511745
Related-Bug: #1483784
Related-Bug: #1482772
Change-Id: I52d13c3f5e7b77a7f8fb1be4dcea437988ebddfe
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove multi-region workaround

When keystone API v3 was introduced, filtering regions when listing
endpoints was not supported (see [1]). This caused multi-region devstack
deployments to fail (see [2]). A workaround was introduced to devstack
to enable for multi-region deployments until region filtering would work
in keystone API v3.
Now that the bug related to region filtering in keystone is resolved,
the workaround should be removed.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1482772
[2]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/devstack/+bug/1483784

Closes-Bug: #1511745
Related-Bug: #1483784
Related-Bug: #1482772
Change-Id: I52d13c3f5e7b77a7f8fb1be4dcea437988ebddfe

subject: Remove 'enable_service tempest' from sample/local.conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 04:49:10.000000000', 'files': ['samples/local.conf'], 'message': 'Remove 'enable_service tempest' from sample/local.conf

tempest is already defined in stackrc as default.
Without this definition in local.conf,
tempest is installed successfully.

If it still needs "enable_service tempest" definition
on local.conf,
devstack itself has some problem.
In my environment, tempest installation works
without this definition on local.conf.

Change-Id: I25cda0142538d21bb9656b471e65ca5b018e8378
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove 'enable_service tempest' from sample/local.conf

tempest is already defined in stackrc as default.
Without this definition in local.conf,
tempest is installed successfully.

If it still needs "enable_service tempest" definition
on local.conf,
devstack itself has some problem.
In my environment, tempest installation works
without this definition on local.conf.

Change-Id: I25cda0142538d21bb9656b471e65ca5b018e8378

subject: Cleanup ReST format issues
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-02 10:28:57.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/guides/neutron.rst', 'doc/source/guides/devstack-with-lbaas-v2.rst', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'doc/source/guides/devstack-with-nested-kvm.rst'], 'message': 'Cleanup ReST format issues

* ReST doesn't allow monospace in italic sections.
      bash$ grep -R \`\` doc/build/html/ --include "*.html"
* The code-block section "::" needed an empty line before the code,
  otherwise it gets shown in the HTML output.
      bash$ egrep -R "<dt>::" doc/build/html/ --include "*.html"
* Monospaced font incorrectly marked with a single back tick
      bash$ egrep -nR '\w`(\s|[\.,;:])' doc/source/ --include "*.rst"

Change-Id: I66c3f685f33851c3f3f0f859996037fc24930246
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cleanup ReST format issues

* ReST doesn't allow monospace in italic sections.
      bash$ grep -R \`\` doc/build/html/ --include "*.html"
* The code-block section "::" needed an empty line before the code,
  otherwise it gets shown in the HTML output.
      bash$ egrep -R "<dt>::" doc/build/html/ --include "*.html"
* Monospaced font incorrectly marked with a single back tick
      bash$ egrep -nR '\w`(\s|[\.,;:])' doc/source/ --include "*.rst"

Change-Id: I66c3f685f33851c3f3f0f859996037fc24930246

subject: Update instructions to generate GMR error reports
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 12:57:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/gmr.rst'], 'message': "Update instructions to generate GMR error reports

Guru Meditation Reports (GMR) code in oslo.reports was recently updated
to expect SIGUSR2 as opposed to SIGUSR1, because it is reserved by
Apache 'mod_wsgi' for its own use.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/223133/ -- guru_meditation_report:
    Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

Change-Id: I4dbf1a11d3737c4a8444b3a79de824acecb56d7d
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update instructions to generate GMR error reports

Guru Meditation Reports (GMR) code in oslo.reports was recently updated
to expect SIGUSR2 as opposed to SIGUSR1, because it is reserved by
Apache 'mod_wsgi' for its own use.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/223133/ -- guru_meditation_report:
    Use SIGUSR2 instead of SIGUSR1

Change-Id: I4dbf1a11d3737c4a8444b3a79de824acecb56d7d

commit_message:
Detach iSCSI latest path for latest disk

The logic responsible to disconnect iscsi volumes wasn't clearing
latest path for the latest remaining disk. With this change,
latest disk path is removed right before iscsi disk is disconnected.

Also, the device descriptor was not removed if the iqn are different
and multipath is enabled.

Change-Id: Ib6f6cea40cc3a14a3a443b157d0decba5602bf13
Closes-Bug: 1374999
Closes-Bug: 1452032

commit_message:
Update neutron-debug to use stevedore aliases

Updating neutron-debug as it is importing interface driver classes
directly and not using the load_driver_interface method.
Also adds unit tests for the neutron-debug tool.

Change-Id: Icf095b2182225e63e85d849d83c2cb36b8a39217
Closes-Bug: #1504536

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-12 03:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/commands.rst', 'doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Enable "openstack server lock" command to take multiple servers.

Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Enable "openstack server lock" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server lock" command could only lock one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: Ifcf103b1c32e6c547ac09f688b887b1c03f92b09
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Fix SDK exception message parse

Currently the error message of SDK exception is not
well parsed, this patch fixed it to make the error
message contain more information to user.

Change-Id: I804893aca4ce03ca3630be0644043ce0ca689621
Closes-Bug: #1515108

This changes the behaviour of has_interface to not assume that
get_resource_info always returns a type. There are circumstances when it
won't, such as when the type is no longer in the new registry during a

Change-Id: Idd9dade85d105dc6839ff0740e6c80aca6b7ad9f

commit_message:
Resource.has_interface check get_resource_info result

This changes the behaviour of has_interface to not assume that
get_resource_info always returns a type. There are circumstances when it
won't, such as when the type is no longer in the new registry during a
stack update.

Change-Id: Idd9dade85d105dc6839ff0740e6c80aca6b7ad9f
Closes-Bug: #1509880
(cherry picked from commit af3355d34c8b8e4030f7a928a6c7cb9ad70e0795)

commit_message:
Allow to specify branch for creating new migration

Add options to 'neutron-db-manage revision' command for specifying
a branch.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I00b00821839b0d77caaaf26b518c5c0c75e01218

commit_message:
Fix typos in documents and comments

Fix typos detected by toolkit misspellings.

* pip install misspellings
* git ls-files | grep -v locale | misspellings -f -

Change-Id: If986f8cfefae08089caa567618dbb13bff0d62d2

commit_message:
py3: Fix error handling in prophetstor driver

* Port prophetstor driver to Python 3
* Replace "except exception as e:" with "except Exception as e:"
  to handle "Fexvisor failed to join the volume ..." and "Fexvisor
  failed to remove the volume ..." errors. Here, lower case
  "exception" is the cinder.exception module, not an exception class.
  On Python 3, "except" requires exception classes.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_prophetstor_dpl

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I0447b62cc0afe5a10ecbc888dfb6608b69f977d2

commit_message:
Enable "openstack server unpause" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server unpause" command could only unpause one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve the
doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: I069ebdd6dcd121f6e55c2bf40d42197f93830e0c
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Remove TEMPEST_CONFIG_DIR in the api tox env""

This reverts commit a3154b03ac60df586bd8fd67f03c20327f2dde41.

The revert was merged too quickly, without waiting for tox project to fix us.
The gate passed for the revert only because infra folks removed images
that had new tox in them. We will be broken by the next images though.

(cherry picked from commit be63289c273fa02159a6958e0b456d5fda217431)

Conflicts:
	tox.ini
Change-Id: I148c80e5b9512fee280ecbf3ca7498ddf1cfd96d

commit_message:
Correct set the default value for min_size/max_size

If min_size/max_size is passed as none, then they will store as
None in db, this patch will correctly set the default values for
them.

Closes-Bug: #1515134

commit_message:
StackUser tolerate missing user on delete

If a stack domain user is missing on delete, we currently fail to
delete the keypair.  We should tolerate this in a simiar way to
that done for _delete_user.

Change-Id: I6d60612e6187385a2d3b6b6fcf67acb99b572fc3
Closes-Bug: #1505981
(cherry picked from commit 730ccc5abf6dd5e133578b4b7fbef32e3b64fe14)

subject: Implement monitoring port changes by port status message
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-20 06:38:04.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ofagent/plugins/ofagent/agent/monitor.py', 'networking_ofagent/plugins/ofagent/agent/ofa_neutron_agent.py', 'networking_ofagent/tests/unit/ofagent/test_monitor.py', 'networking_ofagent/tests/unit/ofagent/test_ofa_neutron_agent.py'], 'message': 'Implement monitoring port changes by port status message

Currently ofagent is monitoring port changes comparing current
and last information got from port description.
The new port monitoring catches port changes using port status
message. This will be useful in the following point.
- This can avoid a vain request of port description.
- The old port monitoring may drop port changes in a case of
  continuous operation deleting and adding a port with same name.
  The new port monitoring can catch all port changes which occur
  between polling interval using port status message.

Change-Id: I856cb35652db239828131c7e10a100534696869d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Implement monitoring port changes by port status message

Currently ofagent is monitoring port changes comparing current
and last information got from port description.
The new port monitoring catches port changes using port status
message. This will be useful in the following point.
- This can avoid a vain request of port description.
- The old port monitoring may drop port changes in a case of
  continuous operation deleting and adding a port with same name.
  The new port monitoring can catch all port changes which occur
  between polling interval using port status message.

Change-Id: I856cb35652db239828131c7e10a100534696869d

as a workaround until the issue in cinder
will be fixed.

commit_message:
Make ssh timeout configurable

Added config option in sahara.conf to enable configurable
timeouts for ssh connections.

Change-Id: Ib0c0ac92229df387a0a5b0474c38af67e5312d2a
Closes-bug: 1506668
(cherry picked from commit 8a43bc1664571ba4bf771bc8ebceab595c760cbb)

commit_message:
Missing stuff for Kafka in Ambari plugin

Open ports for Kafka Broker (default 6667) and also
open port for ZooKeeper (default 2181).

Change-Id: Ifabdcfa295de03a2b1a120bf291c7b876948e921
Closes-bug: 1512661
(cherry picked from commit 08fb1b8ce64d39b1a101e3c4a6074047e1ec578c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-10 23:49:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix cinder objects unit test registration

The base test case was extending test code from oslo_versionedobjects
which is bad because (1) it was adding test objects from the o.vo
registry into the cinder object registry and (2) it was extending
internal private test classes from o.vo which are subject to change and
would break cinder.

This cleans up the base test case and object registration to basically
do it the same way that nova does.

It also moves the duplicate _compare() method into the base class and
fixes a bug where db obj fields that were lists were compared
incorrectly against object lists.

This will allow us to verify object version hashes using o.vo's
ObjectVersionChecker fixture in a follow on change without the
extraneous object registrations from o.vo messing with the results.

Partial-Bug: #1514926

Change-Id: Ie34675e378951cda9aa218f3181dc86767717450
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-11 21:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/test.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_consistencygroup.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_backup.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume_type.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/__init__.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_service.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_cgsnapshot.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_snapshot.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/objects/test_volume_attachment.py'], 'message': "Fix cinder objects unit test registration

The base test case was extending test code from oslo_versionedobjects
which is bad because (1) it was adding test objects from the o.vo
registry into the cinder object registry and (2) it was extending
internal private test classes from o.vo which are subject to change and
would break cinder.

This cleans up the base test case and object registration to basically
do it the same way that nova does.

It also moves the duplicate _compare() method into the base class and
fixes a bug where db obj fields that were lists were compared
incorrectly against object lists.

This will allow us to verify object version hashes using o.vo's
ObjectVersionChecker fixture in a follow on change without the
extraneous object registrations from o.vo messing with the results.

Partial-Bug: #1514926

Change-Id: Ie34675e378951cda9aa218f3181dc86767717450
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix cinder objects unit test registration

The base test case was extending test code from oslo_versionedobjects
which is bad because (1) it was adding test objects from the o.vo
registry into the cinder object registry and (2) it was extending
internal private test classes from o.vo which are subject to change and
would break cinder.

This cleans up the base test case and object registration to basically
do it the same way that nova does.

It also moves the duplicate _compare() method into the base class and
fixes a bug where db obj fields that were lists were compared
incorrectly against object lists.

This will allow us to verify object version hashes using o.vo's
ObjectVersionChecker fixture in a follow on change without the
extraneous object registrations from o.vo messing with the results.

Partial-Bug: #1514926

Change-Id: Ie34675e378951cda9aa218f3181dc86767717450

commit_message:
Refactor HP 3PAR drivers to now be HPE

This patch refactors the HP 3PAR FC and iSCSI drivers to be
HPE 3PAR FC and HPE 3PAR iSCI.

This is being done because the company responsible for the
HP 3PAR FC and iSCSI drivers is now called Hewlett Packard
Enterprise (HPE).

The drivers are now located in the cinder/volume/drivers/hpe
folder.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint rebrand-hp-3par-driver
Change-Id: I529429e00ef5e1b7263d40d9d50ed8ac8535d34a

commit_message:
Add ability to get endpoints from catalog

The barbican plugin requires both the barbican and the keystone
endpoint. Since these are generally in the catalog, we can get them from
there rather than requiring them to be hard-coded.

Change-Id: I926547d2d95b3c59a849c1796342a11cc41b73cc

commit_message:
change comments for hypervisor statistics

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-05 21:25:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add complementary explanation for <host> format of cinder migrate

From Juno, Pool-aware scheduler was introduced. As a result,
destination format of "migrate" and "manage" commands were changed

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-14 19:49:52.000000000', 'files': ['cinderclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Add complementary explanation for <host> format of cinder migrate

commit_message:
Add complementary explanation for <host> format of cinder migrate

From Juno, Pool-aware scheduler was introduced. As a result,
destination format of "migrate" and "manage" commands were changed
as it included pool name like host@backend-name#pool-name.

This patch changes help string of "migrate" to explain more detail
of <host> format to avoid a confusion for users.
Help string of "manage" command already shows detailed <host> format.

Now the latest community document explains this command with
pool-name format.
We also need to update help message of command line.

http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/blockstorage_volume_migration.html

Partial-Bug: 1403902
Change-Id: If984aeb3a8f8f55e1e97cfac43f8866e63d6bb14

commit_message:
Modify URI for endpoints and ipsecsiteconnections

This commit fixes the following VPNaaS URIs:

  * /v2.0/vpn/endpointgroups to /v2.0/vpn/endpoint-groups
  * /v2.0/vpn/ipsecsiteconnections to /v2.0/vpn/ipsec-site-connections

Change-Id: I0bf4fe34e78119119ede896d37a4b7a8dc58f5d9
Closes-Bug: #1515465

commit_message:
Change os-server-actions-add to os-instance-actions

http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#os-server-actions-add-v2.1
No API is called os-server-actions-add, it should be os-instance-actions

Change-Id: Ib273f2797df9aaa9432990843996be169efe46b4
Closes-bug: #1514287

commit_message:
Replace attach_ip_to_server() with add_ip_list()

In later versions of shade, attach_ip_to_server() has been
deprecated and is now a private function. Changed each call
of that function to add_ip_list().

Change-Id: I2dcd0699b3969a03d43d794f156bdc48e213deff

commit_message:
Remove os-pci API in Nova v2.1 API ref

os-pci is not supported, should be removed.

(df) removed os-pci extension from os-hypervisors-v2.1.wadl
(df) updated os-hypervisors calls to show correct examples

Change-Id: I38663fe404ba173a6d85319cd59d228016ab47bd
Closes-Bug: #1514314

commit_message:
Add three pieces of the Session interface

In trying to use betamax with a keystoneauth1 Session, which interacts
by mounting itself as an adapter, it became clear that our wrapping of
requests.Session was incomplete in that regard. Adding an adapters
property with a setter and a mount method worked and betamax is now
totally usable with keystoneauth1.session.

Closes-Bug:#1516382
Change-Id: I1ebc4a726bb516349714e55eb97b384ed40b42cf

commit_message:
Specify default_domain to generic plugin

The generic plugin is supposed to work with both the v2 and v3 APIs.
This doesn't necessarily work because you either need to provide domain
information or not which implies specifying a v2 or v3 preference.

By adding default domain we can allow using v2 or v3 authentication
interchangeably. This is something that openstackclient does already.

Closes-Bug: #1515041
Change-Id: I8d036a080a09b9310ffdd73d3501b6df29a212b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-12-26 09:02:59.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Add profiling support to OpenStack client

To be able to create profiling traces for Zaqar and Glance,
client should be able to send special HTTP header that contains
trace info. This patch is as well important to be able to make
cross project traces. (Typical case end user calls Zaqar or other
service like Glance via OpenStack python client, if profiler is
initialized, Zaqar and Glance client will add extra header, that
will be parsed by special osprofiler middleware at server side)

Don't worry no security issue here, trace information is signed
by HMAC key that is setted in config file at server side. So only
person that knows HMAC key is able to send proper header.

Zaqar server patch is: I32565de6c447cd5e95a0ef54a9fbd4e571c2d820
Zaqar client patch is: I880c003511e9e4ef99806ba5b19d0ef6996be80b

Currently there are some projects are using osprofiler, like Glance, 
Cinder, Heat, and some others are working in progress, e.g. Trove.

Change-Id: I8779d771a73ec51cea0603f2f57ac36433f06eb4
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add profiling support to OpenStack client

To be able to create profiling traces for Zaqar and Glance,
client should be able to send special HTTP header that contains
trace info. This patch is as well important to be able to make
cross project traces. (Typical case end user calls Zaqar or other
service like Glance via OpenStack python client, if profiler is
initialized, Zaqar and Glance client will add extra header, that
will be parsed by special osprofiler middleware at server side)

Don't worry no security issue here, trace information is signed
by HMAC key that is setted in config file at server side. So only
person that knows HMAC key is able to send proper header.

Zaqar server patch is: I32565de6c447cd5e95a0ef54a9fbd4e571c2d820
Zaqar client patch is: I880c003511e9e4ef99806ba5b19d0ef6996be80b

Currently there are some projects are using osprofiler, like Glance, 
Cinder, Heat, and some others are working in progress, e.g. Trove.

Change-Id: I8779d771a73ec51cea0603f2f57ac36433f06eb4
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-24 17:10:27.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'openstackclient/tests/common/test_clientmanager.py', 'openstackclient/shell.py', 'openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Add shell --profile option to trigger osprofiler

This patch add new option --profile that will trigger osprofiler
(tracing) from CLI.

So if you have installed osprofiler lib. And you type
openstack --profile SECRET_KEY user list

At the end of output there will be message with <trace_id>
to plot nice HTML graphs use command:

osprofiler trace show <trace_id> --html --out result.html

Related patch:
(keystone) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103368/
(glance)   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105635/
(nova)     https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105096/

Change-Id: Ia5a168cdb2cdd316b2341ae9753957e16af87c0a
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add shell --profile option to trigger osprofiler

This patch add new option --profile that will trigger osprofiler
(tracing) from CLI.

So if you have installed osprofiler lib. And you type
openstack --profile SECRET_KEY user list

At the end of output there will be message with <trace_id>
to plot nice HTML graphs use command:

osprofiler trace show <trace_id> --html --out result.html

Related patch:
(keystone) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/103368/
(glance)   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105635/
(nova)     https://review.openstack.org/#/c/105096/

Change-Id: Ia5a168cdb2cdd316b2341ae9753957e16af87c0a
